full_desc:
KLDiscovery, a leading global provider of electronic discovery, information governance and data recovery services, is currently seeking an entry-level Hosting Data Analyst/Litigation Support Analyst.
The candidate will have some experience working in an office environment as well as using Microsoft Office, specifically Microsoft Excel. This position does not require any license or certification in order to be considered. We welcome all interested candidates to apply, including recent college graduates. This is an excellent entry into the legal technology field!
Remote, work from home opportunity.
2nd Shift Schedule Tuesday-Friday 2:00 PM to 10:30 PM CST and Saturday 10:00 AM - 6:30 PM CST.
Responsibilities
Work as part of a team, candidate will be required to occasionally work with departments outside of their own, such as Engineering, Application, IT and Project Management teams
Extract, transform and load data to hosted platforms via custom plugins or flat files
Support our customer base through superior customer service, this will include providing technical assistance via telephone, email and screen-shares on various tasks/requests
Account creation and send invitations to end-user(s), occasionally follow-up with a platform walkthrough should it be requested
Creation of databases and establishing permissions for customer use prior to providing credentials to those customers
Investigate client inquiries on their matters concerning printing, search results/creation, technical issues, etc.
Pick up tasks from internal task system, while adhering to internal SLA’s (service-level agreement)
Attend team meetings and company town-halls
Qualifications
Bachelor's degree or professional experience (1+ years)
Knowledge of Microsoft Office; specifically, Microsoft Excel
Strong attention to detail, while managing multiple tasks
Critical thinking skills and ability to retain complex work direction
High technical aptitude or the ability to learn quickly
Ability to work in a fast-paced environment
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
What We Offer
A friendly and welcoming team-oriented environment
Opportunities for career advancement and growth
Business casual dress
Medical/Dental/Vision benefits as well as company provided Life Insurance, Short Term and Long-Term Disability
Paid Time Off & 401k retirement savings plan with company match
Our Cultural Values
Entrepreneurs at heart, we are a customer first team sharing one goal and one vision. We seek team members who are:
Humble - No one is above another; we all work together to meet our clients’ needs and we acknowledge our own weaknesses
Hungry - We all are driven internally to be successful and to continually expand our contribution and impact
Smart - We use emotional intelligence when working with one another and with clients
Our culture shapes our actions, our products, and the relationships we forge with our customers.
Who We Are
KLDiscovery provides technology-enabled services and software to help law firms, corporations, government agencies and consumers solve complex data challenges. The company, with offices in 25 locations across 16 countries, is a global leader in delivering best-in-class eDiscovery, information governance and data recovery solutions to support the litigation, regulatory compliance, internal investigation and data recovery and management needs of our clients.
Serving clients for over 30 years, KLDiscovery offers data collection and forensic investigation, early case assessment, electronic discovery and data processing, application software and data hosting for web-based document reviews, and managed document review services. In addition, through its global Ontrack Data Recovery business, KLDiscovery delivers world-class data recovery, email extraction and restoration, data destruction and tape management.
KLDiscovery has been recognized as one of the fastest growing companies in North America by both Inc. Magazine (Inc. 5000) and Deloitte (Deloitte’s Technology Fast 500) and CEO Chris Weiler has been honored as a past Ernst & Young Entrepreneur of the Year™. Additionally, KLDiscovery is an Orange-level Relativity Best in Service Partner, a Relativity Premium Hosting Partner and maintains ISO/IEC 27001 Certified data centers.
KLDiscovery is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

Why Housecall Pro?
Housecall Pro is a mission-driven company - we champion the Service Pro to success.
We are tackling a large market ($700b+) generally underserved by technology and unencumbered by a dominant competitor.
Competitive compensation and benefits (medical, dental, vision, life, disability, employee assistance program, 401K) that start on day 1.
Our passionate employees bring their authentic selves to work. Housecall Pro employees are encouraged to create employee resource groups to make the world better (think volunteering and philanthropy).
Equity in a growth stage startup backed by top-tier VCs.
Paid holidays and self-managed take-it-as-you-need-it paid time off.
Opportunity to come onboard with a team that is experiencing high growth with ability to explore different career paths.
As a Data Analyst at Housecall Pro, you'll support all departments and help stakeholders to make informed decisions. In this role, you are embedded in a team of data analysts, data engineers and data scientists and you'll work closely with cross-departmental teams, aimed at increasing acquisition, retention and revenue. You'll support building the foundational data and process infrastructure and deliver data products to support the business' scale objectives and manage the Customer Journey. You will work along the entire analytics value chain; starting with raw data sources to final data products. You will foster a culture of data-driveness through experimentation and data governance.
Our Analytics team is extraordinary. Empathetic, hard working and focused on easy data and information access. We are the "insights engine" of Housecall Pro, helping our teams internally as well as the Housecall Pro service professionals to operate and to grow our businesses.

Responsibilities
Work with the Analytics team as well as other key stakeholders
Develop new reports & improve existing reports in Tableau
Troubleshoot issues with existing reports
Collaborate with stakeholders across the company to drill into irregularities and answer business questions
Expand your skills in Tableau and SQL

Qualifications
1-2 years of related work or internship experience in an Analytics capacity
B.S. in Management Science, Business Administration, or a related field
Data affinity and strong attention to detail
Advanced Excel skills
Curious, proactive and drive for impact
Ability to work in highly collaborative, cross-functional environments
Preferred Qualifications:
Familiarity with data visualization software (Tableau)
Proficient in SQL
Founded in 2013, Housecall Pro helps home service professionals (Pros) streamline every aspect of their business. With easy-to-use tools for scheduling, dispatching, payments, and more, Housecall Pro enables Pros to save time, grow profitably, and provide best-in-class service.
Housecall Pro's brand portfolio includes BuildBook, construction management software for builders and remodelers, and CONQUER, a business coaching solution for home services businesses. Our brands are united by a singular mission to champion our Pros to success.
We support more than 25,000 businesses and have over 1,000 ambitious, mission-driven, genuinely fun-loving employees across the United States and all over the world. If you want to do work that impacts real people, supported by a team that will invest in you every step of the way, we'd love to hear from you.
Housecall Pro celebrates diversity and we are committed to creating an inclusive environment. We are an equal opportunity employer and do not discriminate on the basis of gender, race, religion, national origin, ethnicity, disability, gender identity/expression, sexual orientation, veteran or military status, or any other category protected under the law. #LI-PI1
Location Dependent Information
This role is open to candidates and the expected salary range for this role is $70,000-$75,000. The specific salary for the successful candidate will be determined based on permissible, non-discriminatory factors such as skills, experience, and geographic location. This role is also eligible to participate in Housecall Pro's equity plan and the following benefits: health care insurance (medical, dental, vision, disability), employee assistance program, 401(K), flexible time off, paid parental leave, tech reimbursement, and other company benefits. Housecall Pro is growing fast and we're scaling our team to help enable and accelerate our growth.

We have an excellent contract opportunity for a Junior Data Analyst in New York City! If you want to have a big client's name on your resume, this is your opportunity! The AMI Meter Installation Issues Group (MIIG) of our Client is looking for a temporary resource to support the team in reviewing a large data set of meter installation issues and being able to channel the work in and out of our client's database. Excel is the primary application used by various work groups for tracking the progress of the installation. Basic training in the use of Excel will not be provided as the applicant is expected to be proficient.
Other responsibilities are:
The Consultant must be proficient in analyzing and reviewing large data sets in Excel and demonstrate proficiency in using formulas (such as and not limited to Vlookup, Pivot Tables, Graphs, and Charts) to efficiently manipulate the data so that it can be imported into the database
Will review and process large sets of data in the various Client databases and must be proficient in using Excel, PowerPoint, Access database, SQL, and Tableau
Will work independently as well as on a team - Must be self-motivated
The Consultant will learn the functions of AMI and the Legacy applications used by the team with proper training and be able to communicate with end-user customers to resolve issues, and gaps, and collect data
Will be interacting with other vendors on the MIIG team and will be managing the database that is used to issue escalation work for the team to review and be able to receive the data in return and update the database
The Consultant must be flexible and able to work onsite for the first few weeks for onboarding and training. After the onboarding, we can consider transiting to a hybrid work schedule (3 days in the office and 2 days remote)
The Consultant will be responsible for managing the database for tracking legacy meters to upgrade and the tracking of work for the different work streams
The Consultant will be also responsible for managing the work of other MIIG analysts by issuing work from the database and importing reviews completed by the MIIG analyst into the database
Develop and deliver PowerPoint presentations to communicate status, work scope, and workflow
This is an hourly position with opportunity for overtime.

Must have the ability to draft documents

Produce high-quality work and check work frequently
Agile, self-motivated
Must be able to work in a team and as an individual contributor
Experience developing and delivering PowerPoint presentations to communicate status, work scope, and workflow
Preferably with Legacy Experience

Medata prides itself on its experience and leadership in the workers’ compensation and auto liability industries and is dedicated to offering solutions to meet today’s needs and tomorrow’s demands. If you are looking to work with a dedicated team and want to work with the best in the industry, this position is for you. Must be a self starter with great customer service skills.
The focus of the position is on developing and maintaining several data-driven projects and tools. The candidate will collect business requirements, perform data gathering, analysis, and transformation, develop product / project documentation, and provide internal and external customer support by troubleshooting issues. Business Rules Support: Turn business rules requirements into data-driven technical requirements. Implement rules to expedite workflows and automate processes.

RPX Corporation is the leading provider of a comprehensive suite of solutions to help companies manage the risks and costs that arise at any stage of their IP program. To learn more about RPX Services, please visit us at www.RPXcorp.com.
By combining world-class transaction expertise with proprietary data and advanced analytics RPX obtains patent rights that avoid or resolve patent-related disputes shared among our diverse global membership, and provides unique insights that inform our members’ strategic and tactical executive decisions.
What you can expect as a Data Analyst:
As a Data Analyst, you will be solving intriguing problems to help global technology companies, as well as the opportunity to interact with industry leading professionals. You will analyze and visualize data, uncovering legal and business trends in response to questions from RPX clients, internal groups, the press, and academics. The focus of this role is synthesizing data, extracting high level insights, and building persuasive reports and presentations.
In this role, you will:
Provide data-based answers to questions posed by the business and clients
Create customized and standardized reports
Present research findings to internal and external stakeholders
Perform a variety of directed and independent research on IP risk in new technology areas
Collaborate with other internal teams and work self-directed under limited supervision
Locate, assemble, clean, and maintain datasets from internal and external sources
Do you have the experience to join our team?
Minimum Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree required; business, economics, or hard science degree viewed favorably
1+ years developing business reports and/or presentations
1+ years performing analysis
Proficiency with Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint
Strong quantitative analysis skills with a proficiency towards discovering insights, trends, and patterns with large datasets
Detail-oriented; natural curiosity and a quick, eager learner; creative problem solver
Excellent oral and written communications and presentation skills
Preferred Qualifications:
Experience with data visualization
Experience with a SQL-style query language
Interested in Learning More About Us?
In compliance with CA Pay Transparency, the RPX target budgeted salary for this position is $80,000 to $92,000 depending on skills and experience and the RPX base salary range is $65,000 to $117,000. In addition to base salary, we offer an annual bonus opportunity and comprehensive benefits and perks, including group health coverage, company HSA contribution, 401(k) matching, medical disability and family leave benefits, fitness reimbursement, community service days, charitable donation matching, and more, as well as the option to work remotely or from our beautiful San Francisco office.
At RPX, we value diversity. Our differences unlock our strengths. We embrace diversity of thought and background to foster opportunities for innovation and collaboration. We’re committed to creating an inclusive environment of mutual respect, humility and empathy where authenticity is welcomed, and all people are supported. Uplifting each other enhances the well-being of our communities as well as the success of our company. By encouraging everyone to speak, and listening carefully to every voice, we’re better equipped to understand our clients’ increasingly diverse needs and deliver solutions to their most complex problems.
RPX is an equal opportunity employer.
We will make reasonable accommodations to enable any qualified individual with a disability to participate in the job application and interview process, to perform the essential functions of the relevant position, and to enjoy equal benefits and privileges of employment as those enjoyed by similarly-situated employees without disabilities. If you require a reasonable accommodation, please notify RPX HR.

full_desc:
Hydrographic Data Analyst
Remote, US or Richmond, CA or New York, NY | Full-Time
Please note: We unfortunately cannot consider anyone without experience processing at least two of the following datasets: multibeam echo sounder, side-scan sonar, magnetometer, sub-bottom profiler using a software suite such as SonarWiz, Eiva, SonarWiz, Hypack or equivalent.
About Bedrock
Bedrock is operationalizing the largest Earth-exploration mission in human history. We’re doing that by developing robotics & software to explore, map, and classify the entirety of Earth's ocean floor. The oceans are a critical component of climate stabilization. Our hope is to provide critical subsea data and infrastructure to further understand and predict the fundamental forces that support harmonious human existence on this planet.
About You and The Role
Does spending your days staring at dense seafloor datasets and teasing out insights about the nature of our oceans sound like a dream come true to you? Is your favorite part of any project when the initial data comes in and you get to chat about how to improve it with an excited team? Are you a fast mover, an experimenter, a problem solver? At Bedrock you’ll be joining a team of motivated dreamers, providing expertise that helps us to make rapid improvements in our datasets, our autonomous underwater vehicle behaviors, and the insights that we deliver to customers.
What You'll Do
Own first pass data analysis of some/all of the following Bedrock collected datasets: multibeam echo sounder, side-scan sonar, magnetometer, sub-bottom profiler utilizing a standard software package of your choice (e.g., EIVA, SonarWiz, Hypack)
Collaborate with internal teams providing expert guidance on improvements to vehicle and survey plans
Work with product, leadership, and customers to ensure Bedrock data is the highest quality
What You'll Bring

full_desc:
Founded in 2009, Renovo Solutions provides healthcare technology management solutions to help reduce costs, increase quality and improve medical equipment performance in healthcare facilities nationwide. Primarily, Renovo Solutions is a medical equipment service and medical equipment management company that helps hospitals, health systems and medical facilities across the United States to reduce costs and save money. We also provide unbiased and objective healthcare technology management advice and consulting. Renovo Solutions was formed by the Leadership team, innovators in their field with over 100 years of combined experience in the healthcare industry. Drawing from those decades of service and experience, Renovo, which is Latin for “renew”, aims to reinvent and simplify the concept of medical equipment management. Therefore, we provide flexible, customized and comprehensive solutions that address the complexities you face with asset and medical device management. Escalating service costs, decentralized service management and difficulty keeping up with preventative maintenance or repairs are just some of the challenges Renovo can help your medical facility overcome. When you engage Renovo Solutions, you’ll find we are the single source solution – whether that means a comprehensive equipment program and strategy or finding the right balance of involvement of Renovo alongside your biomed and clinical engineering team.
Job Summary:
We are seeking a detail-oriented and skilled Data Analyst to join our team. The ideal candidate will be adept at analyzing and interpreting data, using various reporting tools to answer business questions and provide valuable insights to support decision-making. This role requires excellent communication and collaboration skills, as the Data Analyst will work closely with business stakeholders to understand their needs and deliver actionable results.
Responsibilities:
Collaborate with business stakeholders to understand their data requirements and formulate specific questions to be addressed through data analysis.
Gather, clean, and validate data from various sources, ensuring accuracy and consistency.
Analyze and interpret data using statistical techniques and reporting tools like SQL, Tableau, and Power BI to provide insights and recommendations.
Develop visually appealing and easy-to-understand reports, dashboards, and data visualizations tailored to the needs of the business stakeholders.
Present data-driven insights to stakeholders, highlighting key findings and trends and providing recommendations to support data-driven decision-making.
Continuously monitor data quality and work with engineering and IT teams to resolve data-related issues.
Stay current with industry trends and best practices in data analysis and reporting, and recommend improvements to the company's data analysis processes and tools.
Provide innovative solutions to help improve our accuracy, efficiency, and costs.
Support ad hoc data analysis requests and contribute to various projects as needed.
Requirements:
Bachelor's degree in Data Analytics, Computer Science, Information Systems, Statistics, or a related field.
Minimum of 3 years of experience in a data analyst role or a similar position.
Strong proficiency in SQL, Microsoft Excel, and data visualization tools such as Power BI or Tableau.
Solid understanding of statistical techniques and concepts, including data modeling, trend analysis, and hypothesis testing.
Excellent communication, both written and verbal.
Nice to Have:
Knowledge of various machine learning techniques and their applications in solving business challenges, including supervised and unsupervised learning methods. although proficiency in coding is not required

full_desc:
Are you seeking a new opportunity to use your analytical skills?
The Morning Star Company, the world’s largest tomato processor, is seeking a skilled Business Analyst for a full-time opportunity in their fast-paced environment, using the SQL stack. You will be given the opportunity to analyze large data sets to reveal patterns and improve processes that will impact business operations.
Do you want a job with a company who values your ideas and contributions? Here you will immerse yourself in the unique Mission Focused Self-Management organizational philosophy and connect with Colleagues all across the enterprise. This is definitely not a transactional role. Mission Focused Self-Management empowers all Colleagues to take the initiative and motivate their team to pursue excellence. You will get to know your colleagues as trusted partners and be ready to respond to challenges with agility, qualities that make Morning Star an industry leader.
Morning Star is looking for a customer focused, innovative, and technically skilled colleague to effectively retrieve, integrate, visualize, and present engaging performance measurements and supporting data to all areas of the enterprise. The ideal candidate will have excellent analytical abilities and technical expertise using the Microsoft BI suite of tools. The colleague in this role must be a self-starter comfortable with ambiguity, have strong attention to detail, and enjoy working in a wide variety of business situations. Be ready to show off your skills with Accounting, Warehousing, Logistics, and many other business application data structures. Let us know if you are up for the challenge.
Salary range is $100,000 to $130,000, DOE.

Company Description
The Morning Star Company and its affiliates operate three tomato processing facilities in Central California, processing 35% to 40% of the California processing tomato crop, in addition to tomato transplanting, harvesting and trucking operations. The company employs approximately 500 year-round and 2,700 seasonal colleagues and annual sales of approximately $1 billion.
The Morning Star Company is the largest independent producer of bulk tomato ingredient products (tomato paste and diced tomatoes) in the world. We also produce canned tomatoes, tomato products and specialty sauces in pouches for customers in the retail and food service markets. The company is known worldwide for its innovation and integrity.
We are organizationally structured through a system we term Mission Focused Self- Management™. Our company is operated by colleagues without titles or an appointed hierarchy of authority. Authority relative to other colleagues’ activities is lateral, with our Mission as our guiding principle of action, and respect, influence and success built based on each colleague’s integrity, competency, effort, persistence, and straightforward persuasiveness. Although we have grown significantly, we intend to maintain a culture of individual responsibility and self-management.

Department Purpose
In accomplishing the scope of the CFHL, UC programmatic work, the Research Data Analyst III will work with the State Office evaluation and program staff and the cooperative extension county-based Nutrition, Family, Consumer Sciences (NFCS) Advisors and local county staff. Although supervision will be from the Director (Project Policy Analysis Manager 1 ), leadership and management responsibilities will vary due to the various projects and tasks and will be based on the size and scope of each project. Projects include oversight, training, technical assistance and data quality assurance of program activity reporting by UCCE teams, overseeing site eligibility and site list management and program data summary, analysis, presentation and reporting. Orienting and training staff in 34 counties, developing or modifying reporting and/or site list materials, guidance and supports, written and oral communication and report writing.
Job Summary
As a member of the CalFresh Healthy Living, UC (CFHL, UC) State Office evaluation team, this position will provide programmatic leadership and support for reporting and site eligibility services to the CFHL, UC program which is implemented by University of California Cooperative Extension (UCCE) teams in 34 counties. This position is responsible for managing and contributing to a variety of services related to the collection, reporting, analysis, interpretation, summary and presentation of program information and site eligibility determination and systems. Serves as a source of reporting and site eligibility technical assistance for UCCE teams and responds to program information-related queries from various stakeholders.

Smoking and tobacco use are strictly prohibited in indoor and outdoor spaces, parking lots, residential space, and University vehicles.

Experience with program reporting and monitoring systems

Digital Communications, Data Analyst

This role has been designated as ‘Office’, which means you will primarily work from an HPE office.
Job Description:

Hewlett Packard Enterprise is the global edge-to-cloud company advancing the way people live and work. We help companies connect, protect, analyze, and act on their data and applications wherever they live, from edge to cloud, so they can turn insights into outcomes at the speed required to thrive in today’s complex world. Our culture thrives on finding new and better ways to accelerate what’s next. We know diverse backgrounds are valued and succeed here. We have the flexibility to manage our work and personal needs. We make bold moves, together, and are a force for good. If you are looking to stretch and grow your career our culture will embrace you. Open up opportunities with HPE.
HPE’s Global Communications team has more than 100 communicators across the globe that advocate our corporate strategy, culture, reputation, and innovations. We are storytellers, creatives, producers and journalists, and the heart of HPE’s news engine.
We’re evolving and continually optimizing our approach to data-driven communication, and this is a rare opportunity to help shape the course.
How you’ll make your mark:
As Digital Communication’s Data Analyst, you will deliver insights and ideas that elevate how we engage audiences through compelling content and experiences. The ideal candidate is digitally & analytically savvy, passionate about audience behavior with a keen ability to identify story angles and engagement opportunities. Success requires an innovative and performance-driven mindset – to test, learn and continually optimize. You will:
Deliver measurement and reporting across internal and external channels. Partnering closely with digital channel owners, you’ll help guide our measurement framework, collect and analyze data, and deliver performance reports and insights that inform optimization plans for channels, content and engagement.
Analyze conversation and media coverage for story and content opportunities. Using quantitative and qualitative inputs, you’ll unearth stories and identify owned content and engagement opportunities; that drive audience reach and enhance corporate reputation.
Implement a data automation model across platforms. You’ll help unify performance data into a central data warehouse and onboard Business Intelligence analytics software for analysis. This is an exciting role, and one that’s critical to our data evolution.
Support activation across digital channels. As a key member of an agile team, you’ll step in to support digital channel owners (e.g. HPE Newsroom), including during peak moments and events.
Collaborate cross-functionally on 360° communications programs. Armed with data and insights, you will be called upon to provide insights and expertise that help inform strategies and tactics across Corporate, Business, and Team Member Communication plans.
About You:
We are looking for someone who has:
Superior analytic mindset and problem-solving skills.
Experience with digital measurement, channels, & tools.
Hyper-collaborative nature, excelling in a high-performance, team-oriented culture.
Self-motivation, ambition, and the ability to drive plans.
Passion to test, learn and optimize; within an agile environment.
Ability to work through ambiguity.
Desire to learn in an ever-changing world, technology industry and practice of communication.
Qualifications:
BA or BS in Communications, Business, Analytics or related field
3+ years of experience in data analytics, digital communications or related field
Agency experience a plus
What we can offer you:
Extensive benefits, a competitive salary and participation in the shared values and purpose that make Hewlett Packard Enterprise one of the world´s most attractive employers! At HPE, our goal is to provide equal opportunities, flexible work-life balance, and constantly evolving career growth.

If you are looking for challenges in an exciting, supportive and international work environment, then we definitely want to hear from you. Continue the conversation by clicking apply now below, or directly via our Careers Portal at www.hpe.com/careers.

Join us and make your mark!
Find out more about us and follow us on:
https://www.facebook.com/HPECareers
https://twitter.com/HPE_Careers

HPE is an Equal Employment Opportunity/ Veterans/Disabled/LGBT and Affirmative Action employer. We are committed to diversity and building a team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. We do not discriminate and all decisions we make are made on the basis of qualifications, merit, and business need. Our goal is to be one global diverse team that is representative of our customers, in an inclusive environment where we can continue to innovate and grow together.

full_desc:
If you want to be part of a growing company that’s making a difference in people’s lives, BioCare may be just the place for you! We are a distributor of specialty pharmaceuticals that treat rare diseases, such as hemophilia, immune system deficiency and ALS. We are looking for an Sr Data Analyst I to join our growing IT & Analytics team. Apply today to be part of the BioCare family and support our ability to get the right medication into the right hands, at the right time!
Why you should apply:
Low cost and flexible medical, dental & vision plans
17 days (136 hours) Paid Time Off accrued during your first year
Up to 40 hours Paid Sick Time accrued annually
401k with 5% employer match
Company paid life and disability insurance
Hybrid work schedule
Competitive salary of $100 – 130k, depending on qualifications & experience
Typical duties:
Assess and complete new reporting requests and enhance existing reports
Follow SOPs to design and develop new reports and visualizations based upon defined request
Lead and manage delivery of daily, weekly, and monthly sales, finance, and transactional reports, both manual and automated
Manage data modelling, visualizations, and analysis for existing and new reports
Develop data strategy for projects to onboard new trading partners and systems
Create and manage delivery of routine and ad hoc reports needed to support business and trading partner requests
Lead the development of report standards and best practices or guidelines for repeatable tasks
Use structured and unstructured data from ERP and other systems to develop simple and meaningful data representations that support and fulfill the requests from business users
Support and implement continuous improvement processes across the reporting portfolio to incorporate automation
Mentor analytics team on various data projects, process improvements, and technical innovations
Extract data from identified databases (on premises and cloud), and select appropriate techniques to transform it to a structure that is relevant to the problem
Analyze complex data elements, extract, filter, and aggregate data through logical SQL queries and programming
May provide maintenance support, including enhancements and production support activities
Deliver quality customer service to all team members, customers, and stakeholders
Actively listen and collaborate with end users to design effective solutions that resolve issues
What we are looking for:
Bachelor’s degree in an IT or Computer Science discipline, or equivalent combination of education and experience
7+ years’ experience as a reports developer/analyst with the ability to read and write complex queries, create database objects (tables, views, stored procedures, user-defined functions), and create complex visualizations and dashboards
Expertise in Power BI from creating complex dashboards, visualizations, DAX queries to managing data security
Sound experience designing and developing reporting solutions with SSRS/PBRS and other MSDN tools
Experience with Azure Data Factory, Azure Data Warehouse is a plus
Expert in different SQL techniques for data transformation and data analysis
Experience in working source control tools such as SVN and GitHub
Certification in Power BI modeling, visualization and analyzing data is preferable
Quality and Improvement focus to ensure reliable, timely, and complete data
Ability to multitask and prioritize competing tasks
Possess an analytical mindset and problem-solving aptitude
Familiarity with working in Agile environment leveraging DevOps, change management process, and tools like Jira
Ability to work independently and in a fast-paced, high growth environment
Excellent organizational skills and focused attention to detail
Must be able to pass a drug test and background check aligned with company and accreditation standards
We are an equal opportunity employer, and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, gender, marital status, national origin, ancestry, disability, genetic information, medical condition, military/veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Company Summary
Come join First American's Digital Title Group, newly formed to re-imagine and digitize the title search and examination process through Big Data, AI, document automation and modern, cloud-native application development. As a market leading title insurance company, powered by the nation's largest and most complete property information, ownership and recorded document database, First American is committed to advancing title automation and removing friction from the real estate closing process. Our modern title decisioning solutions create certainty and speed through data and analytics, delivered to real estate agents, lenders, title agents and homebuyers. Join a team that puts its People First! Since 1889, First American (NYSE: FAF) has held an unwavering belief in its people. They are passionate about what they do, and we are equally passionate about fostering an environment where all feel welcome, supported, and empowered to be innovative and reach their full potential. Our inclusive, people-first culture has earned our company numerous accolades, including being named to the Fortune 100 Best Companies to Work For® list for seven consecutive years. We have also earned awards as a best place to work for women, diversity and LGBTQ+ employees, and have been included on more than 50 regional best places to work lists. First American will always strive to be a great place to work, for all. For more information, please visit www.careers.firstam.com.
Job Summary
Senior Data Analyst (remote)
Company Summary
Come join First American's Digital Title Group, newly formed to reimagine and digitize the title search and examination process through Big Data, AI, document automation and modern, cloud-native application development.
As a market leading title insurance company, powered by the nation's largest and most complete property information, ownership and recorded document database, First American is committed to advancing title automation and removing friction from the real estate closing process.
Our modern title decisioning solutions create certainty and speed through data and analytics, delivered to real estate agents, lenders, title agents and homebuyers.
Job Summary
We're looking for Senior Data Analysts interested in transforming our industry by solving cutting-edge problems with modern technologies, want the benefit of working for an established real estate insurance leader and seek a culture awarded as a Fortune 100 Best Companies to Work.
The ideal candidate will have a deep understanding and demonstrated ability to transform, enrich, and synthesize large data sets from disparate sources in order to deliver meaningful insights to the business.
The candidate will also have strong proficiency in the ability to create actional insights and visualizations to highlight business critical metrics.
Essential Functions
Participate in the requirement gathering process with the business, technical groups and Project Management
Drive requirements to design, develop, and maintain reporting and analytic data sets as required to support business needs
Create technical specifications from functional requirements through analysis of business processes and discussion with the business process owners
Ensure designs are consistent with our development standards

Knowledge and Skills/Technology Used
Demonstrated experience with SQL
Proven working experience in data discovery, data cleansing, validation, and analysis
Ability to use data visualization tools and methods in performing data quality reviews
Experience performing analysis to assess quality and meaning of data; interpret patterns and trends in complex data sets
Possess a creative, systematic, and logical approach to problem-solving
Preferable experience working in cloud-based DB platforms (we use Snowflake)
Excellent verbal and written communication skills, and experience interfacing with clients, data modeling and science teams
B.S Degree in a relevant discipline (C.S., CIS, Statistics, etc) (preferred, not required)
Experience
5+ years of total experience, preferably working with public record data
Pay Range: $71,500 - $148,500 annually. This salary range is a good faith and reasonable estimate of the salary range of possible compensation at the time of the posting and is subject to change. The compensation offered will be determined by various factors, including a candidate’s education, training, experience, and geographic location.
#LI-MD1
#LI-REMOTE
First American invests in its employees' development and well-being, empowers them to provide superior customer service and encourages them to serve the communities where they live and work. First American is committed to diversity and inclusion. We are an equal opportunity employer.
Based on eligibility, First American offers a comprehensive benefits package including medical, dental, vision, 401k, PTO/paid sick leave and other great benefits like an employee stock purchase plan.

full_desc:
Summary
Posted: Mar 28, 2023
Weekly Hours: 40
Role Number: 200471114
Imagine what you could do here. The people here at Apple don’t just create products — they create the kind of wonder that’s revolutionized entire industries. It’s the diversity of those people and their ideas that inspires the innovation that runs through everything we do, from amazing technology to industry-leading environmental efforts. Join Apple, and help us leave the world better than we found it. We seek an individual experienced in Business Intelligence (BI) and data analysis to drive the requirements and execution of our global initiatives in support of a worldwide business development and strategy team. We work in a startup atmosphere where individuals take ownership and have significant impact on the final product. The ideal candidate will be organized and reactive to the challenges of a fast paced environment with ability to handle ambiguity and build structure. This person will have proven experience with technology and strong business acumen, with the ability to evaluate, analyze, influence and collaborate across all levels of the organization.
Key Qualifications
3-5 years of related experience in data analysis.
Strong understanding of finance and BI concepts.
Background in finance, accounting, operations, management consulting, or other high-performance organizations desirable.
Outstanding communication and presentation skills with the ability to quickly filter and distill relevant information for the right audience.
Solid facilitation skills (requirement sessions; design meetings; progress and status meetings) to drive technical design discussions with engineers and proposing simple, creative solutions to complex problems.
Self-motivated and proactive with demonstrated critical thinking and creative problem-solving skills.
Ability to assimilate and learn complex processes in a changing and dynamic work environment on a steep learning curve.
Experience in working in teams using Agile frameworks such as Scrum or Kanban.
Hands-on experience with SQL, Business Objects, Tableau, Essbase or other analytic tools with a drive to learn and discover new technologies. Scripting knowledge in Python/Shell is preferred.
Description
In this role, you will: Represent the business in all requirements, solution design, and project delivery conversations showcasing knowledge of business strategy and values/impacts. Act as a liaison between the business and technical teams, translating business needs into analytical requirements. Deep dive into various financial & hierarchical data points in different sets of hierarchies, understanding the nuances of how complex data behaves. Analyze business and data requirements to propose and to design solutions. Immersive exploration of Apple’s finance datasets, applying various data discovery & modeling methodologies while working cross functionally with different data owners and analysts. Proactively communicate data methodology and results to a diverse set of stakeholders concisely in a timely manner. Ability to work in an agile team with a ‘hands-on’ approach. Clarify and validates user stories, as needed, to the business. Collaborate closely with the Product Managers to align on scope, priorities, and quality of project delivery. Assist in production support and maintenance of executive level BI applications.
Education & Experience
Bachelor's degree in a Business, Engineering or Computer Science field with quantitative emphasis required
Additional Requirements
The ideal candidate for the position will have extensive experience working within global companies with a strong global approach and a solid understanding of cultural differences. Given the nature of the role, the ability to work independently when managing multiple priorities in an unstructured, global and virtual environment is critical. The successful candidate will have a proven track record of working well with all levels of leadership and an ability to effectively engage stakeholders and customers to ensure that projects are delivered according to expectations on time and within budget.
Pay & Benefits
At Apple, base pay is one part of our total compensation package and is determined within a range. This provides the opportunity to progress as you grow and develop within a role. The base pay range for this role is between $96,500 and $145,000, and your base pay will depend on your skills, qualifications, experience, and location.

Apple employees also have the opportunity to become an Apple shareholder through participation in Apple’s discretionary employee stock programs. Apple employees are eligible for discretionary restricted stock unit awards, and can purchase Apple stock at a discount if voluntarily participating in Apple’s Employee Stock Purchase Plan. You’ll also receive benefits including: Comprehensive medical and dental coverage, retirement benefits, a range of discounted products and free services, and for formal education related to advancing your career at Apple, reimbursement for certain educational expenses — including tuition. Additionally, this role might be eligible for discretionary bonuses or commission payments as well as relocation. Learn more about Apple Benefits.

Note: Apple benefit, compensation and employee stock programs are subject to eligibility requirements and other terms of the applicable plan or program.

Job Title: Data Analyst
Job Level: Individual Contributor
FLSA Classification: Full-Time, Non-Exempt
Pay Range: $15.00 - $17.00 per hour
Employment Type: At-will
Reports to: Data Management Supervisor
Location: Remote or Louisville, CO 80027

Job Summary:
Data Analysts are on the front lines of building a standardized product classification structure and product catalog for the legalized cannabis industry. They are successful at coding and cataloging cannabis products for inclusion in our reporting service, Greenedge. Data Analysts are computer savvy, curious and resilient in taking vague information and forming thoughtful and logical outcomes. They evaluate, classify, and enrich point-of-sale data from cannabis retailers for all brands, products, and strains into our proprietary database with accuracy and speed.

Essential Functions and Responsibilities:
Ability to process large data sets of point-of-sale information by evaluating and classifying information into proprietary software
Audit data through standard verification processes to detect errors
Create and curate documentation standardizing categorization
Excellent communication skills across team members and cross-functionally
Ability to provide accurate and concise information to leadership or cross functional teams
Ability to navigate quickly through custom software
Understand the impact catalog entries and changes have to the business and product
Ability to identify patterns which help to classify large quantities of data and create efficiencies
Perform other duties as assigned

NOTE: Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

Education and/or Experience:
High School Diploma, GED or equivalent combination of education and experience
MS Office proficient, particularly in Excel
Prior experience with data management software
Knowledge of Cannabis and related products preferred
Prior experience in dispensary compliance and/or bud tending is preferred
Data entry experience a plus

Pay Range: $15 - $17/hr.

BDSA is an equal opportunity employer. All aspects of employment including the decision to hire, promote, discipline, or discharge, will be based on merit, competence, performance, and business needs. We do not discriminate based on any pay inequities nor on race, color, religion, marital status, age, national origin, ancestry, physical or mental disability, medical condition pregnancy, genetic information, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, veteran status, or any other status protected under federal, state, or local law.

Applicants must be authorized to work for ANY employer in the US. We are unable to sponsor or take over sponsorship of employment visas at this time.

We are seeking an experienced Business Analyst to work with our client to assist the LifeCycle Management team in updating the legacy application portfolio for the finance service area, which involves moving the on-prem applications to Azure. This is a remote opportunity.

full_desc:
Overview:
This is a unique and exciting time to join Express. Since launching our EXPRESSway Forward strategy in 2020, we have been steadily advancing a transformation from being known as a store in the mall to a brand with a purpose, powered by a styling community. We believe that clothes can serve a higher purpose to make people look the way they want to look and feel the way they want to feel, and our Express brand purpose – We Create Confidence & Inspire Self-Expression – speaks to the role our brand can play in their lives. In 2021, we introduced our innovative Community Commerce program, inviting brand fans and style enthusiasts to take their passion for fashion to the next level by working with us.

Today, we are building, activating and amplifying the Express styling community, and we invite you to join us. Our culture is defined by three values – Express Yourself, Express Together, Express Success – and every associate at every level in every department is an important part of our transformation and our future.

For more information about Express, Inc. please visit www.express.com.
Responsibilities:
We are looking for an Associate Cybersecurity & Data Privacy Analyst to join our retail organization headquartered in Columbus, OH. The selected candidate will be a key member of our Governance Risk and Compliance team, helping ensure our adherence to various legal and privacy regulations. This position can be a remote opportunity with occasional travel to the headquarters as needed. Ideal candidates will have experience with privacy and governance workflows, data subject access requests, and relational databases. This is a great opportunity to learn and grow within the dynamic privacy and compliance field!

Respond to Data Subject Access Requests (DSARs). This will include communicating with customers, internal personnel, and external parties
Coordinate privacy and governance workflow activities, and identify opportunities for process improvements and automation
Facilitate privacy assessments, compile data inventories, and maintain operational templates
Compile DSAR reports and privacy KPIs/metrics
Assess identify verification and reconcile DSAR submission data with internal systems using SQL based queries
Review data trends and privacy laws/requirements for potential business/customer impact
Educate other teams on privacy requirements and required actions needed
Standardize process and procedures around privacy and governance

REQUIRED EXPERIENCE & QUALIFICATIONS
Strong knowledge of relational databases/queries (e.g. SQL)
0-3 year of experience contributing to privacy and governance programs
Strong technical understanding of data stores, models, architecture, flows, and diagrams
Experience with governance solutions such as OneTrust
Knowledge of structured and unstructured data
Knowledge of SDLC is beneficial

CRITICAL SKILLS & ATTRIBUTES
Possesses and demonstrates curiosity
Ability to proactively identify opportunities for process and efficiency improvements
Demonstrates excellent communication skills to both technical and non-technical personnel
Ability to clearly articulate and tenaciously drive alignment across multiple teams and departments
Ability to create and describe project estimations with assumptions and risks
Ability to work in a fast-paced environment while managing multiple responsibilities
Executes with limited to no supervision; self-motivated and self-directed

Closing:
As an equal opportunity employer, Express does not discriminate in hiring or terms and conditions of employment on the basis of any federal, state, or locally protected class. Express only hires individuals authorized for employment in the United States.

Notification to Agencies: Please note that Express does not accept unsolicited resumes or calls from third-party recruiters or employment agencies. In the absence of a signed Master Service Agreement and approval from HR to submit resumes for a specific requisition, Express will not consider or approve payment to any third-parties for hires made.

full_desc:
Harris & Harris has over 50 years of experience in customer care and revenue recovery, specializing in the utilities, government, and healthcare markets. We’re looking for friendly, professional, and motivated IT Business Analyst to join our Information Technology team. If you’re looking for a company that embraces the principles of respect, compassion and trust, please apply with us today!
IT Business Analyst
The IT Business Analyst is responsible for working with internal and external clients to intergrate procedures with our systems, manage quality control of programs, results, and reporting to eliminate issues and ensure client satisfaction.
Schedule: Regular business hours are 8:00am to 5:00pm Monday through Friday, on-call and after hours responsibilities may be required on a rotating basis.
Location: can work remotely, Chicago candidates preferred
Salary: $85,000.00 to $100,000.00 annually, dependent on experience
Additional Compensation and Benefits:
At Harris & Harris, we truly care about each employee’s health, wellness, financial stability, and education. We are proud to offer each employee the following benefits:
Medical and Dental insurances from premium providers
401K with matching
Company paid Accident and Disability Insurance, Long Term Disability Insurance, EAP, and Travel Assistance
Tuition Reimbursement
Paid Time Off
Additional benefits such as identity theft protection, flexible spending accounts, pre-tax commuter benefits, and more.
DAY TO DAY
Manage the quality control of operational programs, results, and reporting for all clients in order to eliminate issues and increase client satisfaction.
Troubleshoot reported application issues and help facilitate a resolution to prevent future issues going forward.
Execute various corporate and client projects as assigned within tight deadlines.
Manage documentation creation and updating of policies and procedures to ensure that all team members understand the correct manner for completing their tasks
Coordinate configuration and programming tasks internally, as well as externally with clients and vendors.
Perform data analysis to interpret trends, optimize efficiency and evaluate data quality.
Responsible for the design and testing of custom programming applications.
Ability to successfully create ad hoc reporting on-demand and develop specifications to recurring reports for programming to help increase department productivity.
Listen closely and understand the specific needs of other departments to ensure that reporting is accurate and relevant.
Create and present data results to various internal departments to aid them in interpreting the data and make recommendations
Work collaboratively with other IT members as needed for programming initiatives, changes to routines, file processing, strategies, letters, and other functions as related to client operations.
Assist with help desk requests/tickets directly through telephone or online ticketing system as needed
WHAT YOU MUST POSSESS
Must Have:
High School Diploma required
Minimum of three years of experience in a technical or application support environment with experience troubleshooting custom software applications/databases
Application development/programming experience
Ability to work in a fast-paced and ever-changing work environment
Must be well-spoken, as well as be able to understand client needs and suggest appropriate solutions
Excellent communication skills (written and verbal)
Excellent analytical, problem solving and time management skills
Nice To Have:
Bachelor’s Degree preferred
Excellent analytical, problem solving and time management skills
Experience with the CUBS system preferred
Experience with UNIX system a plus
Excellent project management skills a plus ·
WHY HARRIS & HARRIS?
Harris & Harris is a premier, full-service revenue recovery firm headquartered and founded in Chicago, IL. Founded in 1968, we have been in business for more than 50 years, and we specialize in the utilities, government, and healthcare markets.
The family business Sam Harris started is now a firm of more than 500 hundred employees including collections professionals and customer care representatives who employ the latest technology and best ethical practices to help businesses recover revenue and provide world class customer service.
We take pride in knowing what it takes to turn a call from "average" to "excellent." We have been delighting clients and customers for decades thanks to our outstanding employees. They make the difference every day, shift, and call and transform challenges into victories.
At Harris & Harris, we’re proud to be an organization where everyone is welcome and can be their authentic selves at work. We’re passionate about celebrating the differences that make each of us unique. Our culture focuses on our employees and we look for opportunities to recognize and celebrate together. We are an organization that cares about our people. From monthly activities, bonuses and contests, to competitive wages and benefits, we foster an environment where we employees feel valued.
We also are an organization that believes in the power of giving back. Our internal cross functional committee, Harris Cares, guides our philanthropic activities. We have partnered with organizations such as One Warm Coat, Greater Chicago Food Depository, American Cancer Society, Bright Pink, The Heat and Warmth Fund (THAW), and Operation Stars and Stripes. Most recently we have partnered with local schools and charitable organizations to give back to our communities including the American Heart Association, Habitat for Humanity, A Just Harvest, and R. Nathaniel Dett Elementary School.
At Harris & Harris, everyone is important, and one person can make a difference for their colleagues, for our clients, and for our company. We look forward to hearing from you!
Harris & Harris is an equal opportunity employer. Applicants will not be discriminated against based on race, color, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, religion, national origin, disability, ancestry, marital status, veteran status, medical condition or any protected category prohibited by local, state or federal laws.

Job Description:
As a contractor to the Access Hub Strategy team, this individual will be responsible for supporting the development and implementation of key strategic initiatives.
The Analytics and Operational support function enables the effectiveness of patient financial service programs by performing various tasks across a broad spectrum of responsibilities.
This individual will need to effectively collaborate cross-functionally to deliver business results. The role does not have direct reports but demonstrates the ability to lead without authority and work collaboratively with the integrated commercial team.
Responsibilities:
Partner with Program Managers, vendor partners and MABI to track program performance through conducting variance analysis; provide analyses via periodically generated reports on key metrics and trends.
Strengthening the execution of access and reimbursement hub support on day-to-day activities, projects, and initiatives.
Developing an understanding of U.S. patient services; build strong working relationships with cross functional teams (Patient Services, Finance, Purchasing, MABI and Compliance)
Manage purchasing activities including purchase orders, statements of work and invoice approvals. This includes assisting in tracking and coordinating work specific financial activities.
Work cross-functionally with various internal teams to develop and implement patient support services designed to meet the brand business objectives for optimal support of patients and health care professionals in compliance with regulatory guidelines.
Collaborates with technical and business support staff. Participates in projects and completes tasks assigned by more experienced analysts and managers.
Use Analytics to help tell a story, provide insights into program performance and market trends, and validate the performance of the program.
Manage escalations appropriately across cross functional partners and programs and work with team members to create and track hub escalations.
Oversee compliance reporting on a daily, weekly and monthly basis across all hub support vendors.
Requirements:
Bachelor's Degree preferred
2+ years of experience in patient financial services or relevant experience
Functional knowledge in as many of the following areas as possible: Patient Financial Services, Insurance Landscape, Hub Support/Services, Compliance, Drug Reimbursement and Pharmacy Services.
Experience working both independently and in a team environment.
Lead small projects to delivery tactical results.
Strong time management skills.
Strong oral and written skills
Excellent interpersonal skills

full_desc:
**We are interested in every qualified applicant who is eligible to work remotely in the United States. However, we are not able to sponsor VISAs.

Are you a Data Management Analyst with experience in Data Management and/or Governance Applications? Are you looking for your next opportunity? If so, consider joining us on our mission of helping our communities achieve better health!

What Will be Your Purpose?
Data Management Analysts support Data Management Consultants, and work directly with data governance stakeholders, business leaders, subject matter experts, and other technology professionals to create and execute on data risk reduction or value improvement propositions. The scope of this work involves one or more of the following data management disciplines: reference data management, data protection, data stewardship, master data management, data platform management, data strategy or data enablement and capabilities. Applies data protection or business value requirements to design, document and recommend possible data management and governance solutions. Participates in the creation of business specifications and contributes to system specifications aligned with business requirement and needs. Provides input into data management and governance project plans. Prepares, maintains, and contributes to data management and governance deliverables and artifacts, including flow charts, conceptual models, policies, procedures, standards, desktop procedures, guides, glossaries, code sets, metrics, scorecards and reporting to assist with the ongoing operation and maintenance of data management and governance solutions. Assigned to complex projects, systems or initiatives related to ongoing organization data management and governance needs. Data Management Analysts lead efforts, oversee work results, provide meeting facilitation and training, and serve as data experts for other business, technical and analytic resources.

What You’ll be Doing?
Produces and maintains data management products and artifacts as part of operational- or project-based tasks and ensures necessary design considerations are made in alignment with documented requirements.
Contributes to the operational- or project-based analysis and documentation of data-related assets, sources, business, and technical requirements; identifies impacted areas/systems/technical and business processes; and evaluates solutions and best practices.
Participates in and provides consultation during the review of system requirements and functional design solutions for data assets, functionality and enhancements to existing data assets and functionalities.
Takes the initiative to seek out areas of improvement.
Contributes to final review of design specifications to ensure business stakeholder/end user/data consumer needs are met.
Researches and assists in developing approaches for identifying and Resolving system or data-related problems.
Participates in efforts to identify and evaluate alternative solutions.
Acts as a matrix leader - partnering with business and project leaders to ensure goals are achieved; and identifying opportunities and efficiencies and overcoming obstacles with projectized work.
Performs analysis for highly complex projects, systems, or initiatives.
Act as a mentor to other business, technical and analytics partners and analysts.
Works with technical staff to ensure system components and functional flow of / between components is compliant with documented requirements.
Ensures adherence to practices, standards, policies, and procedures.
Assists in executing tests or validations for various system components and data transformations / migrations.
Influences business/IT/analytics stakeholders by recommending decisions and solutions built on approved requirements, value propositions and business case roadmaps.

What You Must Have?
Required Work Experience: 6+ years related work experience in Data management, data governance, data quality improvement, data security, data protection, data analytics, data-focused business or systems analysis, application development, data architecture or comparable role.
Required Education: Related Bachelor’s degree or additional related equivalent work experience IT, Data or Analytics field.

Thorough knowledge of Information Technology systems supporting data management.
Demonstrated organizational, analytical, and interpersonal skills.
Demonstrated ability to meet customers' needs by understand business drivers, process and data needs and translate them into implementable data solutions that create value for the organization.
Strong understanding of integration points of assigned business/systems and processes.
Proven leadership abilities including effective knowledge sharing, conflict resolution, facilitation of open discussions, fairness and displaying appropriate levels of assertiveness.
Proficient in requirements gathering methodologies and the software development life cycle (SDLC).
Understanding of a variety of architecture standards and ability to apply them in their design work.
Proven communication skills, with the ability to convey technical information in a meaningful way (technical and business).
Strong problem solving and critical thinking skills to evaluate alternatives and present solutions that are consistent with business objectives and strategy.
Extensive knowledge and experience of systems, subsystems, development methodologies, systems architecture, tools, and processes that support the assigned business initiative or system.
Experience in applying continuous improvement, DMAIC, data/process analysis or other similar methodologies to business solutions.
Knowledge of systems development concepts and methods.
Experience with business requirements and business process analysis to ensure IT solutions meet the business needs.
Experience managing multiple priorities and ability to facilitate adoption of changing priorities.
Demonstrated negotiation skills and ability to build relationships.
Experience interacting with data systems (like Oracle, SQL Server, IBM DB2, or Hadoop/HBase).
Experience writing database queries in languages like SQL or SAS.

What is Preferred?
Health care or health insurance industry related experience.
Data management or data governance related experience.
Experience with business, technical, and data process engineering.
Experience using Agile methodologies (like SAFe).
Experience using Agile project management applications (like Broadcom Rally).
Experience with quality assurance tools (like HP ALM).
Experience with data management and governance applications (like Informatica).
Preferred Education: Technology, Data or Analytics Degree.

General Physical Demands:
Sedentary work: Exerting up to 10 pounds of force occasionally to move objects. Jobs are sedentary if traversing activities are required only occasionally.

We are an Equal Opportunity/Protected Veteran/Disabled Employer committed to creating a diverse, inclusive, and equitable culture for our employees and communities.

Job Description:
The technical and business analyst is responsible for addressing advanced inquiries, requests for enhancements, and supporting B2B clients.
We are looking for an organized, detailed-oriented person that is adept at learning and supporting our world leading B2B software for automating complex 24 hour shift based scheduling of staff. This individual will gain familiarity with specific client instances of our cloud hosted software suite, be able to troubleshoot and dialogue with developers as needed to resolve client requests and inquiries. The selected candidate will develop an intimate knowledge of their assigned client base's usage of this system, via automated usage tracking forms, and maintain relationships with the relevant client POCs.
Under the guidance of senior staff:
map the workflows of the use of our products by customers
create user surveys to assess their difficulties and their readiness to use our products, and the level of training they may need
document result of regularly scheduled calls to clients to discover client feedback about the use of our software products and the level of satisfaction
create presentations of findings of clients to Management and to clients about ideas to optimize product performance and satisfaction including items ranging from custom product enhancements, configurations, to refresher training
participate in the delivery of product enhancements, from requirements gathering and specifications to working with the development team, business stakeholders, and client for a smooth delivery
respond to client inquiries in a timely manner
Qualifications:
Ideally have a background in computer science, economics or have some exposure to computer science and IT
Hold a degree from a reputable university, with a GPA of 3.0 or higher or have commensurate work experience
Proficiency in MS Excel and Visio (or like applications)
Programming knowledge is not required
We are looking for someone that lives within a reasonable distance from the office (an hour or less).

full_desc:
Overview:
The Business Analyst (BA) role serves as a key intersection between various information technology solutions, the providers of these solutions, and their users within Forefront Dermatology. Business Analysts are responsible for mapping workflows, identifying pains, opportunities to gain efficiency, and innovating to thoughtfully solve while ensuring solutions may be measured for efficacy, adoption, and success whenever possible. The BA collaboratively prioritizes and advocates effectively to solve the most meaningful problems in the most measurable way.
Responsibilities:
Develop and leverage extensive expertise in tasks, workflows, and supporting systems within a domain.
Represent the voice of the user and clearly represent their needs and objectives in the form of problems to solve, opportunities, and pain points.
Identify, measure, and report on key success metrics.
Own the adoption and utilization of technology solutions leveraged within domain, ensuring obstacles and risks are identified and thoughtfully mitigated or accepted.
Intimate understanding of most important business objectives/jobs to be done within their domain, and keeps this at the forefront of decisions.
Advanced technical skills.
Familiar with and advocate for multi-disciplinary best practices, including cybersecurity, privacy, regulatory, and other compliance areas.
Ability to influence stakeholders and work closely with them to determine acceptable solutions.
Triages and represents issues and opportunities back to existing vendors.
Leads new initiative assessment campaigns, and curates opportunity roadmap for domain.
Challenge status quo constructively in search of opportunities to automate, optimize, and measure.

Qualifications:
Education & Experience
Bachelor’s degree in business or related field, or in lieu of degree, equivalent education, training and work-related experience
Minimum 2-5 years of experience in business analyst, functional analyst, or product management roles
Demonstrated leadership experience including serving as an example to others with regard to professional behavior, handling multiple tasks, maintaining a positive and constructive attitude, and in response to organizational change

Knowledge, Skills and Abilities
Must be detail oriented, curious, and able to document both workflow and technical needs effectively.
Excellent communication skills including creating reports and presentations and effective delivery to peers, stakeholders, and leadership.
Proficiency with Microsoft Word, Excel and PowerPoint is required, as are workflow mapping and SDLC tools.
Ability to work effectively and cooperatively with staff, board, clients, and the public.
Ability to multi-task, prioritize appropriately, and work well both individually and as part of a team.
Ability to use time productively and contribute to high levels of company operational efficiency and effectiveness.
Ability to maintain confidentiality of information.

full_desc:
APPLICATIONS MUST BE SUBMITTED THROUGH CALCAREERS: https://www.calcareers.ca.gov/CalHrPublic/Jobs/JobPosting.aspx?JobControlId=362054
The CalSTRS Enterprise Strategy Management Division is seeking a motivated individual to work as a Business Process Analyst, (Research Data Analyst II), on the Continuous Improvement Team.
The Enterprise Strategy Management Division is responsible for organization-wide strategic management, business planning and organizational performance, research and development, and enterprise sustainability in support of CalSTRS mission. These business areas work together to increase CalSTRS’ ability to integrate performance data and conduct research to identify enterprise-wide issues used to inform the Teachers’ Retirement Board and executive staff to arrive at sound conclusions and make educated decisions. Together, these functions are instrumental in meeting and reporting on strategic goals for the organization.
The Continuous Improvement Team is responsible for planning, organizing, directing, and executing all activities related to the development, maintenance, implementation and executions of business process improvement and business process reengineering. CIT works to foster organizational awareness; bridge cross-functional process improvement; improve efficiency and effectiveness in work processes; support risk analysis and risk mitigation; and formalize and document processes.
CalSTRS is committed to creating an organizational culture that promotes employee engagement to design a workplace where employees thrive and members receive exemplary products and services.
Under general supervision of the Research Data Manager, the Research Data Analyst II is responsible for identifying complex operational improvement opportunities using a variety of established methodologies for business process analysis and implementation, and independently performing extensive research, analytical, and advisory duties in support of the Continuous Improvement Team (CIT) mission.
The ideal candidate will possess the following skills:
Working knowledge of Lean Six Sigma for operational excellence and organization performance management
Business analysis and project management experience
Ability to influence change
Ability to analyze data using various applications such as Excel, SPSS, R
Understanding of change management strategies and methodologies
Experience using various facilitation strategies
Presentation skills to a variety of audiences including executives and senior management
Telework Information: We offer a hybrid approach including in-office and remote work solutions with staff working on-site at our Headquarters in West Sacramento 2 days per week.
Job Type: Full-time
Pay: $69,516.00 - $87,072.00 per year
Benefits:

Professional development assistance

8 hour shift
COVID-19 considerations:
We offer a hybrid approach including in-office and remote work solutions with staff working on-site at Glendale Member Service Center 2-3 days per week.
Work Location: Hybrid remote in West Sacramento, CA 95605
