full_desc:
POSITION TITLE: Data Analyst

DEPARTMENT: Information Systems
REPORTS TO: Data Analytics & Programmer Manager

JOB SUMMARY: Under the supervision of the Data Analytics & Programmer Manager, the Data Analyst collaborates with multidisciplinary teams to support the organization’s data needs by developing ad-hoc and recurring reports. OLE Health is Federally Qualified Health Center providing care and serving the most vulnerable in our Napa and Solano communities. Each patient works with a dedicated team of medical professionals to get the range of services they need, when and where they need them. Our non-profit organization proudly local and have cared for our communities for 50 years.

LOCATION: Primarily remote and occasional on-site work at one of our main locations in Napa, CA as needed:
North Campus: 1141 Pear Tree Lane Napa, CA 94558
South Campus: 300 Hartle Court Napa, CA 94559
Please keep in mind, the ability to work and meet on-site as needed is a requirement.

THE TEAM:
Our Data Department consists of our:
CIO with over 25+ years of healthcare information technology who understands how data drives and effects decision making
Data Analytics & Programmer Manager who manages data-related projects and collaborates with stakeholders to support their department data literacy and development
Data Analyst who supports departments with routine ad-hoc and recurring reporting development
Data Programmer who develops software tools to automate and improve workflows

Responsibilities:
Collaborate with Data Department and stakeholders: Confirm data requests by reviewing objective, input/output requirements, and timeframes to support clinical care teams, quality improvement, and reporting needs of the organization.
Conduct ongoing data collection: Analyze health information from a variety of sources including eClinicalWorks, BridgeIT, Relevant, Excel, etc. for quality improvement, internal operations, UDS, and other reporting requirements.
Data reporting development: Write, validate, and document large amounts of SQL code to build data reports and dashboards for end-user usage and functionality.
Expectations:
Attention to verbal/written detail, manage priorities/workflow, and ability to work independently without supervision or collaborate with a multidisciplinary team
Critical, creative, and analytical thinker for solving data-related problems and can adapt what is known to what is needed
Strong interpersonal skills and ability to communicate thoughts and ideas effectively
Data literacy comprehension: Interpreting results and presenting findings to stakeholders into language stakeholders can understand
Committed to providing high quality, accurate, and timely data to improve patient care
Regular attendance and punctuality are necessary
Demonstrate maturity and understanding to always maintain confidentiality of patient and organizational information

Education:
Preferred bachelor’s degree in health-related informatics, computer science, statistics, data analytics/data science, engineering, public health, or other related fields

Experience:
Minimum of one year working as a data analyst, developer, or equivalent strongly preferred
Minimum of one year directly related experience in healthcare - health information technology, quality improvement, data analytics/data science, or information management strongly preferred

Skills:
Intermediate to advanced SQL comprehension and querying required
Intermediate to advanced competency in Excel (Functions, Vlookups, Pivot Tables, etc..) required
Familiarity with Relational Database Management Systems (MSSQL and PostgreSQL) preferred
Familiarity with SQL IDE (JetBrains DataGrip, DBeaver, etc.) preferred
Familiarity with data analytical platforms (Relevant, PowerBI, Tableau, etc..) preferred
Familiarity with HRSA/UDS, Partnership HealthPlan QIP, CMS, PCMH, etc. reporting preferred
Familiarity navigating Electronic Health Record (e.g., eClinicalWorks, EPIC) systems preferred
Proficiency with Microsoft Office 365 applications including Outlook, Word, Excel, PowerPoint, OneDrive, SharePoint, and Teams preferred
Intermediate to advanced level of knowledge of project management practices and methodologies preferred
Experience with programming languages (Python or R) for data manipulation and analysis preferred, but not required
Familiarly with GitHub preferred, but not required

BENEFITS

10 Paid Holidays
Vacation &Sick (16 days)
Medical,Dental, Vision
403(b)retirement plan with a 4% match
TuitionReimbursement
Life insurance
Flexible Spending Account

full_desc:
Wiliot was founded by the team that invented one of the technologies at the heart of 5G. Their next vision was to develop an IoT sticker, a computing element that can power itself by harvesting radio frequency energy, bringing connectivity and intelligence to everyday products and packaging, things previously disconnect from the IoT. This revolutionary mixture of cloud and semiconductor technology is being used by some of the world’s largest consumer, retail, food and pharmaceutical companies to change the way we make, distribute, sell, use and recycle products.
Our investors include Softbank, Amazon, Alibaba, Verizon, NTT DoCoMo, Qualcomm and PepsiCo.
We are growing fast and need people that want to be part of the journey, commercializing Sensing as a Service and enabling “Intelligence for Everyday Thing”.
This role offers a unique opportunity to engage in tactical data exploration and to build out solutions on top of the insights you identify. You will sift through massive amounts of data to discover “Ah ha!” moments for key customers that connect the dots between our technology and their key problems. You will then work with internal teams, and key customer teams to turn these insights into integrated solutions. Creativity, curiosity, and resilience are key for this role as you often won’t know what we’re looking for until we’ve found it.

Requirements:
Bachelor's degree in Math, CS, data science/engineering or equivalent analytical degree
2-5 years of relevant professional experience
Strong Python skills
Experience with SPARK strongly preferred.
Visualization tools experience including UI design (Plotly, Tableau, PowerBI, Grafana)
Understanding of statistical analysis and relational database structures (SQL, Influxdb a plus)
Strong analytical and quantitative problem-solving abilities
Excellent interpersonal and communication skills
Ability to be self-sufficient and execute quickly when given autonomy
Experience with IoT data streams and business context a plus
Flexible team player who will thrive in a dynamic, constantly evolving environment
#LI-Hybrid

Responsibilities:
Participate in customer meetings and carefully listen for pain points and business problems
Develop visualization interfaces (internally and in customer systems) to maximize data value and useability in the customer business context
Mold real time series data stream into actional insights
Hunt to uncover new insights in data generated by customer deployments
Build and deliver technical presentations to customers
Communicate effectively with engineers from many disciplines (including algorithm, software, and hardware engineers)
Work with internal product teams and customer teams to turn insights into integrated solutions.

full_desc:
About FAIR Health
FAIR Health, Inc., a national, independent nonprofit organization, was established in October 2009 with the mission to help assure fairness and transparency in health insurance information. FAIR Health has created a database of over 40 billion de-identified private healthcare claim records—the largest in the country—which receives claims monthly and which serves as the foundation for a variety of data products, custom analytics and consumer tools. FAIR Health has also been certified by the Centers for Medicare & Medicaid Services as a “Qualified Entity” and thus holds the entire collection of Medicare Parts A, B and D claims from 2013 to the present, which get routinely refreshed.
Our standard data modules, custom analytics and technological tools serve all participants in the healthcare sector nationwide; they are licensed to payors, third-party administrators, bill review companies, self-insured employers, government agencies, academic researchers and consultants. Our medical and dental data are used to inform statutes and regulations, healthcare cost indices, fee schedules, benefit and provider network design, practice/facility expansion, health systems research and dispute resolution, among other uses. We also offer a suite of consumer-oriented tools and resources available on our consumer website (fairhealthconsumer.org), as well as mobile applications, which can be licensed by other organizations.
Summary of Position
The Senior Healthcare Data Analyst will be responsible for a variety of data analysis, evaluation and reporting solutions. This individual will support the innovation, enhancement and development of analyses of underlying claims data and product methodologies, including the design and development of related solutions to accomplish these tasks.
The candidate will also translate internal business needs into data-driven deliverables and products with responsibility for the creation of SQL queries and SAS programs necessary to meet those needs. Working with other analysts and business representatives, this individual should be able to report and present results and findings to various levels of the organization.
The successful candidate will have an understanding of healthcare claims data and a working knowledge of healthcare coding concepts (ICD, HCPCS, CPT®, etc.). This individual should also have a strong analytic and statistical background and be able to extract information from the database and create usable and actionable outputs. The ideal person will have a broad knowledge of medical and dental data, healthcare fee schedules and data products, as well as an ability to apply that knowledge to data solutions.
Primary Responsibilities
Work with SQL to query, merge and analyze large datasets.
Evaluate analyses to derive informative and well-organized results that can be documented and presented to stakeholders in the form of tables, charts and graphs.
Understand and work with all aspects of healthcare claims data to identify trends and other salient information.
Work on FAIR Health data products and create reports and analytics that reflect actionable, value-infused information.
Evaluate and establish the validity of FAIR Health data product information to ensure accuracy and completeness of all reporting results.
Work with database technologies, such as Oracle and statistical analytical toolsets, such as SAS to evaluate datasets and produce analytic result sets, including graphical representations of the data.
Utilize healthcare data knowledge to help to craft data analyses to support client analyses and internal products.
Investigate and resolve issues independently related to FAIR Health data products.
Knowledge and Skill Requirements
Required Skills
Master’s degree in Public Health, Statistics or related field, or equivalent work experience.
2+ years of experience with SQL.
Experience working with large databases.
Strong presentation skills to support the presentation of technical material and concepts to senior managers and non-technical audiences.
Comfortable working with various levels of an organization.
Strong interpersonal skills, including the ability to work in a highly cross-functional, multi-location organization.
Highly proficient with MS Excel, PowerPoint and Word.
Ability to proactively engage in all aspects of project definition through implementation, problem assessment through resolution and reporting for presentation, while focusing on both big picture and specific project detail.
Ability to self-manage and appropriately govern multiple projects on a day-to-day basis.
Preferred Skills
5+ years of experience working for a health insurer or healthcare-related organization, including consulting or technology companies, with responsibility for analysis of large healthcare datasets.
Knowledge of medical claims data, including, but not limited to, professional claims, outpatient claims, inpatient claims, specialty pharmacy and pharmaceutical claims.
A working knowledge of healthcare coding (CPT, HCPCS, ICD, revenue codes, DRG).
Familiarity with healthcare fee schedules, including, but not limited to Medicare, Workers’ Compensation and Medicaid.
Knowledge of business intelligence toolsets, such as Tableau.
Knowledge of statistics and statistical toolsets, such as SAS.
Location: Remote or a possibility to work from our New York City office post-pandemic.
Salary is commensurate with experience in range of 85K - 105K annually.
FAIR Health, Inc., is an equal opportunity employer and an E-verify participant. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or national origin.
FAIR Health offers a competitive compensation package and includes the following benefits: Medical, Dental, Vision, Flexible Spending and Dependent Care Accounts, Life and Disability Insurance, Paid Time Off, Paid Holidays, 401(k) and Discretionary Bonus.

full_desc:
Company
An estimated 7.39 million people in the US have an intellectual or developmental disability (IDD). Of those 7.39 million, 1.58 million people with IDD received benefits from a state Medicaid agency. Circulo Health is reinventing how people with IDD are supported with services guided by empathy, innovation, and cutting-edge technology. We are putting humanity back in health. We’ve built a team of talented, enthusiastic professionals and are looking for those interested in improving the lives of millions of Americans. Join us today.
*
The Role*
We are currently looking for a data analyst to build Circulo’s data/analytics function to ensure the effective and efficient delivery of capabilities to position Circulo as an industry leader. This role is dedicated to building data driven solutions that have a measurable impact across all parts of the organization. The Data Analyst will be responsible for building data products, reporting and analysis that provide insights to help Circulo effectively run its business.
Who we are looking for:
Bachelor’s degree in a quantitative discipline such as statistics, Informatics, 0-3 years of experience
Strong background in SQL
Ability to understand business processes and how they relate to underlying data
Demonstrated ability to clean, synthesize and validate data analysis
Ability to communicate technical information to non-technical audiences
Python experience a plus
Ability to work collaboratively within matrices, virtual and flat environments.
Strong communication, interpersonal skills, and ability to build relationships, and influence with self-awareness, maturity, and integrity.
What you will do:

SUMMARY: Collects, analyzes, and stores data to help facilitate business decisions across the company. Develops reports and analysis to support a variety of initiatives. DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES:
Responsibilities include, but are not limited to:
Create data-based tools and metrics to facilitate business decisions across functional departments.
Perform data analysis to increase efficiencies and profitability across the organization
Identify patterns and trends in data sets
Analyze inventory trends and create demand forecasting tool to proactively reduce inventory values
Identify obsolete product and utilize channels to deplete inventory
Work alongside teams within the organization to establish business needs and prioritize requests
Utilize software programs to expedite the acquisition and accuracy of data.

Offer insights and suggestions on situational findings

The Analyst, Marketing Analytics, collaborates with the team to analyze the performance of marketing efforts across MGM’s database and direct marketing in support of acquisition, retention and reactivation of marketing campaigns with a focus on competitive market analytics, engagement trends, booking behaviors, campaign effectiveness, and more for MGM Resorts’ portfolio. The Analyst will provide actionable insights and recommendations to maximize offer/campaign profitability, share of wallet, customer retention and loyalty, and revenue opportunities to drive business performance. This individual will support a world-class Marketing Analytics team and help define its required technology and toolset. As part of our team, you’ll work with professionals at our portfolio of casino resorts across North America – as well as those in the corporate executive level – to implement analytics initiatives that move the business forward. All duties are to be performed in accordance with departmental and MGM Resorts policies, practices and procedures.
PRINCIPAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:
Analyzes complex data sets and extracts key insights using various economic, financial, customer, and marketing methodologies
Synthesizes data, insights, and consumer research to create presentations that make fact-based recommendations
Collaborates with the Marketing Analytics team to communicate recommended approaches to senior leaders, and anticipate the future needs of our customers
Builds event proformas and conducts post-analysis for casino events, promotions, and shows
Performs ongoing analysis of segment and offer performance
Prepares for and participates in monthly marketing reviews with property and Marketing COE teams
Visits properties regularly and participates in marketing strategy meetings
Identifies business requirements and collaborates with the Enterprise Reporting team in the pass-off of requirements for execution and BI / IT development
Develops analytics capabilities across aligned functional areas and properties
Reviews findings with and makes recommendations to the EA leadership and business partners
Balances new insight against current projects and continually seeks innovation through ongoing networking and research efforts

Bachelor degree or equivalent experience.
At least (1) one year of experience in Marketing with experience in driving business performance through operational insights and analytics
CERTIFICATIONS, LICENSES, REGISTRATIONS:
Gaming license(s) in applicable jurisdictions
Proof of eligibility to work in the United States
KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, AND ABILITIES:
Intermediate proficiency with Microsoft Excel
Understanding of traffic drivers, data visualization, problem solving, preferred HTML or JavaScript, and adaptation skills to work with various web and channel management tools
Ability to anticipate situations, tools needed, and obstacles through critical thinking and review of business performance
Ability to listen effectively, process information, ask appropriate questions for clarification and execute tasks accordingly
Ability to work in a high-stress, fast-paced environment managing multiple projects and personnel simultaneously. Must possess ability to prioritize conflicting duties and maintain timeline integrity for projects and tasks
Must possess excellent communication skills and demonstrate ability to resolve all situations in a professional manner
Ability to appropriately manage confidential departmental and corporate information
Must have excellent written, verbal and public presentation communication skills
Must have initiative and strive for continuous improvement. Proven ability to participate in implementing innovative ideas, projects and business solutions
Clear understanding of change management preferred. This should include participating in the development or implementation of solutions which require comprehensive shifts in operational practices
Ability to gather process information and make recommendations and decisions based on data and findings
Ability to produce high quality work products, with consistency, accuracy and completeness
Ability to self-manage while consistently exercising good judgment and maturity

Excellent customer service skills

full_desc:
JOB TITLE: Sr. Analyst, Brand Data Visualization and modelling (Vans)
About the Team
VF’s Analytics and Insights team is building a community of boundless decision intelligence. We are accountable for building the systems, operating models, and insights that drive better, faster decisions across VF’s brands and functions. Whether it’s market and supply chain opportunities or supporting a better understanding of the consumer and how to serve them, we:
1) drive decision intelligence by curating and maintaining an evergreen suite of adaptable data product solutions and insights that drive action,
2) democratize data access and usage by building and sustaining a service model that empowers and enables widespread data access and self-service, and
3) build data literacy across VF by championing a culture of data-driven decision making
With a clear aspiration to be a trusted catalyst of transformative effect across VF, we live by these values:
Discovery
We lead with curiosity and seek to understand why before what
We are pathfinders that push the boundaries of what’s possible and drive decisive action
We take risks and courageously challenge the status quo
Connection
We embrace and incubate diversity of skills, capabilities, and perspectives while emphasizing a bias for action
We are sought out as thought partners and co-creators
We transparently request and provide feedback for continuous improvement
Simplification
We democratize data literacy and access, and measure our outcomes
We create consistency and trust through practical governance that evolves and scales
We believe truths and not tools power our competitive advantage
About the Role
The Sr Analyst, Brand Data Visualization and modelling will be a dedicated resource to VF’s Vans brand and work closely with the Vans’ Global Digital Strategy team to interface with business stakeholders and peers to meet the business’ analytical needs while managing and developing the Analytics team. In this capacity, strong leadership, training, and communication skills are important as this role will be providing guidance and recommendations to peers and business vertical leaders. This will entail effectively translating business requirements into plans and actionable items. The successful candidate will be a global catalyst for amplifying data visualization and decisioning capabilities that spark efficiency, drive business decisions, and foster innovation and growth for the Vans brand.
While dedicated to the Vans brand, the role will report into VF Corporation’s centralized Integrated Analytics and Insights team and will benefit from the synergies, standards, and learning opportunities that come from being part of a broader VF Insights and Analytics community that spans brands, regions, and functions.
A strong understanding of BI tools, such as Tableau, Alteryx, Denodo and/or Looker, with emphasis on the ability to design intuitive and insightful visualizations is a must. Advanced understanding of data warehouses, such as Amazon Redshift, as well as data virtualization is also critical. Experience with SQL is a must.
Key Accountabilities:
Provide thought leadership and focus on the big picture. Establish, socialize, and execute the data strategy based on key areas - people, processes, data, and technology. Align strategy, resources, project plans, and goals to business objectives
Work cross-functionally with brand stakeholders and data lake development team to identify, analyze, and design core data models to support self-service reporting and analytics
Creatively explore how data can continually add value to Vans. Translate ad hoc questions into flexible tools & methodologies that scale to answer broad problems across the organization.
Apply strong storytelling acumen to develop and design presentations, reports, data visualizations and other deliverables. Summarize findings to key stakeholders and executive leadership, communicating with both technical and non-technical team members
Embed yourself in the development lifecycle for new & existing analytics packages by creating ideas through collaboration with peers, building initial data prototypes, supporting data development, deploying visualizations for production systems and participate in the update and improvement over time.
Evangelize the evolution of business reporting into decision intelligence, leveraging data science, modeling, and AI into data products that automate or aid in scalable decisioning
Establish and maintain principles, role definitions, responsibilities, standards, procedures, and accountability for data development practices, reporting and visualization
Expand technical skillset to utilize both code-based and non-code-based tools to create reporting data models efficiently and effectively
Manage and create reporting and visualization projects involving timelines, vendor relationships, and budgets to ensure projects are delivered with the highest quality and within specified timeframes
Develop and maintain consultative and collaborative relationships with key business stakeholders to proactively identify and address business intelligence needs
Establish, centralize, embrace, and champion common design practices for data visualization. Drive standards and KPI’s for reporting and data visualizations within Vans while simultaneously supporting efforts to drive consistency, standardization, scalability and simplicity across VF’s brands, functions, and regions
Required Knowledge, Capabilities and Experience:
Years of Related Professional Experience: 5-7 years
A formal education and subsequent graduate degrees are nice to have, but we are most interested in your total experience and professional achievements.
Advanced understanding of data modeling for reporting and analytics functions with at least Basic understanding of consumer analytics and web analytics data like Google Analytics or Adobe Analytics
Experience with multiple systems in any of the following areas including; AWS (S3, Redshift), Alteryx, Power BI, BI HANA, Tableau, SAP BODS , SQL Server, MySQL, Data Warehouse Appliances, Oracle, Teradata, Looker, SAS, SPSS, ThoughtSpot, Cognos, Datorama, Domo, Denodo, and other related products
Demonstrated understanding of retail, wholesale, CPG, or footwear and apparel industry business processes and how data is used within them, with awareness of industry processes and data sets including Demand, Inventory and Supply Planning, Financial Analysis and Forecasting, Product Data, Point of Sale (POS) Data, Buy Planning, Marketing Campaign Management, Social Media Data – Facebook Business Manager, Google Analytics, Big Query, Google Ads, Consumer Data such as Experian Mosaic
Proven track record of delivering and managing multiple projects and priorities demanding both rigorous attention to detail and high-level comprehensive solutions
Design-oriented thinking focused on end-users - experience making a variety of static and interactive visualizations for a variety of audiences. Awareness of design concepts related to chart forms, typography, and the use of color. Ability to design visualizations that are intuitive to navigate, responsive, and informative.
Experience with multiple technology service delivery models and methodologies (Agile, waterfall, DevOps)
Proven ability to lead and drive organizational and cultural change as well as build and develop a high functioning team
Strong project management skills
Skills and Attributes for Success
Demonstrated critical thinking and analytical skills; ability to apply systems knowledge to troubleshoot and analyze new issues is critical
A self-starter, able to work independently with a proactive working style
Excellent collaboration skills - be able to listen to business stakeholders, understand their needs, plan analytical solutions that will assist them, effectively translate their needs to technical peers, and be able to set expectations around development and delivery of projects while keeping development teams on track.
How You Will Make a Difference:
Be an owner – Take ownership of the future state of the data landscape
Be a doer – Dive in and deliver on the promises to help achieve business value
Be the expert – Study, research and know your space deeply
Pay Range:
$84,000.00 USD - $126,000.00 USD annually
Incentive Potential:
This position is eligible for additional compensation awards that may include an annual incentive plan, sales incentive, or commission potential. Specific details of the additional compensation eligibility for this position will be provided during the recruiting and interview process.
Benefits at VF Corporation:
You can review a general overview of each benefit program offered, including this year's medical plan rates on
www.MyVFbenefits.com
and by clicking Looking to Join VF? Detailed information on your benefits will be provided during the hiring process.
Please note, our pay ranges are determined and built from market pay data. In determining the specific compensation for this position, we comply with all local, state, and federal laws.

full_desc:
Powering Performance Marketplaces in Digital Media
QuinStreet is a pioneer in powering decentralized online marketplaces that match searchers and "research and compare" consumers with brands. We run these virtual- and private-label marketplaces in one of the nation's largest media networks.
Our industry leading segmentation and AI-driven matching technologies help consumers find better solutions and brands faster. They allow brands to target and reach in-market customer prospects with pinpoint segment-by-segment accuracy, and to pay only for performance results.
Our campaign-results-driven matching decision engines and optimization algorithms are built from over 20 years and billions of dollars of online media experience.
We believe in:
The direct measurability of digital media.
Performance marketing. (We pioneered it.)
The advantages of technology.
We bring all this together to deliver truly great results for consumers and brands in the world's biggest channel.

Job Category
In this role you will become an expert on optimal performance and strategy of digital marketing campaigns. You will work with fellow analysts to analyze, conjecture, and manage investigations, product fixes, and optimizations to increase our yield and support our relationships with Media Partners.

You will be required to develop a deep understanding of the related data sources and leverage them to inform business decisions. You will be required to develop a deep understanding of our analytical tools and the automation of business processes and decision-making. You will need to leverage diverse problem solving strategies and balance multiple simultaneous efforts in a dynamic and high velocity environment.

You will be expected to delve into business problems and analyze opportunities for growth. You will be a locus for understanding advantages, weaknesses, and deploying creative approaches to analytical problems; you will be expected to communicate these insights in an effective and timely manner, responding to the analytical needs of the business, and delivering actionable plans for improving our business.

Responsibilities
Develop a deep understanding of the related data sources and leverage them to inform business decisions
Develop a deep understanding of our analytical tools and the automation of business processes and decision-making
Leverage diverse problem solving strategies and balance multiple simultaneous efforts in a dynamic and high velocity environment
Dive into business problems and analyze opportunities for growth
You will be a locus for understanding advantages, weaknesses, and deploying creative approaches to analytical problems
Communicate these insights in an effective and timely manner, responding to the analytical needs of the business, and delivering actionable plans for improving our business.
Qualifications:
2+ years of experience in an analytical role is required
Inquisitive mindset that is willing to challenge status quo and various stakeholders
Ability to digest disparate datasets and visualize key trends or takeaways from raw datasets
Excellent communication and presentation skills with the ability to synthesize key takeaways and present data-proven results
Strong analytical, organizational and problem-solving skills including abnormality detection, predictive analysis, market segmentation, and competitive analysis.
Experience in using SQL with enterprise datasets is required
Experience in R or Python is required
Experience with Tableau or other related Business Intelligence Tool is required
Experience with automation in an enterprise setting is a major place
The expected salary range for this position is $80,000 USD to $120,000 USD annually. This salary range is an estimate, and the actual salary may vary based on the Company's compensation practices. The salary may be adjusted based on applicant's geographic location. The position is also eligible to receive performance bonus or commission and equity in the form of restricted stock units. This position is eligible to participate in the Company's standard employee benefits programs, which currently include health care benefits; (2) retirement benefits; (3) the amount of paid days off (paid sick leave, parental leave, paid time off, or vacation benefits); (4) any other tax-reportable benefits.

full_desc:
The role of a Business Analyst is to understand the business landscape and the changing needs of the business.


Role Specifics
What

Content

Day in the life

In this role, you will help your Team stakeholders to analyze business requirements, processes, and information systems, and will also help the Product Owner drive the business in the right direction by collaborating to improve the clients products, services, and software with the help of data analytics. As a Business Analyst you will help bridge the role of IT and business while improving the clients overall efficiency.

Must-have skills

On day one we'll expect you to...
Participate in all Scaled Agile team and PI events.
Understand business requirements from multiple stakeholders and help prioritize them.
Interpret business requirements and simplify them for easy analysis of the team to create solutions for delivery.
Work in close collaboration with the Technical Lead and Development team to ensure the team understands the requirements.
Ensure the team is Delivering the correct elements of system design, business rules, and other relevant deliverables.
Break down the technical and architectural requirements so that the entire team understands the infrastructure and technical requirements.
Be actively involved in capturing new business requirements and communicating them with the development team.
Help the Business and Product envision future needs among changing business processes and models.

What separates the best from the rest

Excellent soft skills apart from the domain and technical knowledge requirements. Have an ability to pull reports and analyze data streams to identify useful trends.
Possess excellent verbal and written skills.
The right mix of program management and project management expertise.
Having the right interpersonal and consultative skillsets is an advantage.
Work on high-level detail and being able to interpret accurate results.
The right organizational skills, you need to be very efficient in working with diverse teams within our clients.
A good understanding of the business and the respective functional domain.
Capability to position the right solutions that are actionable, and addresses the business requirements and challenges identified.
In-depth knowledge of requirement specifications and development, process flows, and developing business use case scenarios.
An understanding of process modeling, agile, and waterfall software development methodologies.

Team culture

Servant Leadership is prioritizing your team and organization above your objectives. Empower your team members to have their voices heard, and decentralize decisions to help create efficiency and collective ownership with the teams in the following area:
Effective communication and facilitation skills
Coach and mentor attitude
Proactive problem solving, and conflict resolution
Eager to learn, curiosity is limitless
Extreme ownership in your role and responsibility

About TMG
At TMG, we are relentless in self-improvement. We believe in deep collaboration and cross-pollination of our teams, which allows us to solution in ways others can not. We believe in taking responsibility for making things happen rather than explaining why it can't be done. We believe in doing what is right for our clients, even to our detriment. Honoring these beliefs is why our customers depend on us year after year.

About Lumen
Lumen is guided by our belief that humanity is at its best when technology advances the way we live and work. With 450,000 route fiber miles serving customers in more than 60 countries, we deliver the fastest, most secure global platform for applications and data to help businesses, government and communities deliver amazing experiences. Learn more about Lumen’s network, edge cloud, security and communication and collaboration solutions and our purpose to further human progress through technology at news.lumen.com, LinkedIn: /lumentechnologies, Twitter: @lumentechco, Facebook: /lumentechnologies, Instagram: @lumentechnologies and YouTube: /lumentechnologies.
The Role
Lead Data Analyst with Anaplan Model Builder Certification. As a Lead Data Analyst at Lumen you will be a key member on the Strategic Analytics and Reporting team that implements Anaplan solutions across the organization and maintains existing builds.
The Main Responsibilities
With your existing Anaplan model builder skillset, you will partner with various sales, marketing, and finance functional areas of the company to design and implement models to plan and analyze sales territories and account modules for multiple segments of the company
Maintain existing models and expand functionality between models
Translate existing solutions, spreadsheets, and business problems into dynamic Anaplan multi-dimensional models where information can be shared across the organization
Provide hands-on training to end users to facilitate adoption of the Anaplan model
Perform root cause analyses and propose solutions
Utilize and share Anaplan model building best practices
Being comfortable with using LOOKUP, SUM, SELECT, COLLECT, ALM, Revision Tags, Subsets, and Line-Item Subsets, and Actions
Work closely with Anaplan Systems Manager and the Data Analytics team on ongoing Anaplan projects

Are you a self-motivated individual who knows how to use Data to tell a story?
Inova Health System Office is seeking a Clinical Data Analyst II to perform data analysis and reporting to support the implementation of clinical effectiveness, performance improvement, and service line initiatives across Inova Health System. Provides quality assurance, data validation, and report generation to support the department. Synthesizes data into meaningful information in selected functions. Identifies preliminary improvement opportunities from analyses.
This is a full-time hybrid (open to remote) Monday -Friday position.
Job Responsibilities:
Maintains a thorough understanding of available software and maps departmental needs to available solutions.
Manipulates and interprets data from clinical databases, coded data, and other specified data sets.
Uses appropriate statistical, visual, and narrative displays of data in a manner that is easily and appropriately interpreted by the target audience.
Validates or models data with the purpose of understanding or making conclusions from the data for decision-making purposes.
Develops and tests reports and analyses from various sources, including but not limited to – quality and financial outcomes databases, electronic health record, and safety event data.
Responsible for creation, timely submission, and distribution of numerous monthly, quarterly, annual and ad hoc data reports/scorecards.
Qualifications
Experience:
Three (3) – Five years’ experience in healthcare data analysis and decision support, including demonstrated proficiency with analytical software, data tools, data visualization, and business process documentation tools.
Preferred:
Statistics, informatics, or quantitative area of study, healthcare administration, or related field of study. Solid proficiency in statistical methodology.
Education:
Bachelor’s Degree in healthcare or information systems management, mathematics, economics, data science, engineering, or other quantitative data and analytics field.
Benefits and Perks:
Health, Vision, and Dental Coverage
Life Insurance, Short/Long Term Disability
Retirement: Inova matches dollar for dollar the first 5% of your eligible pay that you contribute to the plan
Competitive salary: Pay based experience

Supplemental Plans: Including Auto/Home Insurance discounts, Pet Insurance, Identity Theft Protection
Additional Benefits: Educational Assistance of up to $5,250/year, Student Loan Refinancing, Adoption Assistance, Child Care Centers, Scholarship Program, Free Parking, Exclusive savings opportunities to in-store events, theme parks, discounts, movie tickets and local offerings and so much more!

full_desc:
About:
The Premier Lacrosse League (PLL) powered by Ticketmaster is a men’s professional lacrosse league in North America, composed of 8 teams rostered by the best players in the world. Co-founded by lacrosse superstar, philanthropist, and investor Paul Rabil and his brother, serial entrepreneur and investor, Mike Rabil, the Premier Lacrosse League is backed by an investment group composed of Joe Tsai Sports, Brett Jefferson Holdings, The Raine Group, Creative Artists Agency (CAA), Chernin Group, Blum Capital, The Kraft Group, Arctos Sports Partners, and other top investors in sports and media. The PLL is distributed through an exclusive media rights agreement with ABC, ESPN, ESPN2, and ESPN+. The PLL was recognized by Front Office Sports’ 2021 Best Employers in Sports. For more information, visit www.premierlacrosseleague.com and follow on social media: Instagram (@PLL), Twitter (@PremierLacrosse), Facebook (@PremierLacrosseLeague), YouTube (YouTube.com/PLL) and TikTok (@pll).
Company Values:
Stay grounded
Think critically
Encourage creativity
Persevere through the noise
Operate like an owner
Be helpful
Position Overview:
The Premier Lacrosse League is seeking a highly motivated Data Analyst to join the growth team. Reporting to the manager of Data Analytics, the ideal candidate has expertise in data visualization and SQL and is passionate about creating business value through designing and developing robust and performant data models.
Collaborating across ticketing, merchandise, product, youth academy, and other business teams, this position will design and implement datasets and reports in BigQuery and Looker, as well as perform analysis and share underlying trends and actionable insights to help our stakeholders in decision-making.
This opportunity will get you working on large scale structured, unstructured data sets, apply various data engineering and modeling techniques on the real-world datasets to build and deploy models. A well-qualified candidate should be highly technical with strong business acumen. They are a self-starter with abundant intellectual curiosity who excels at framing problems analytically, comfortable working through ambiguity, and have a proven track record of helping leverage analytical insights to drive impactful decisions.

Responsibilities:
Evaluating business processes, anticipating requirements, uncovering areas for improvement, and developing and implementing solutions.
Leading ongoing reviews of business processes and developing optimization strategies.
Create segmented audiences for targeted messaging.
Creating intuitive and informative dashboards.
Effectively communicating your insights and plans to cross-functional team members and management.
Gathering critical information from meetings with various stakeholders and producing useful reports.
Managing projects, developing project plans, and monitoring performance.
Updating, implementing, and maintaining procedures.
Serving as a liaison between stakeholders and users.
Staying up-to-date on the latest process and IT advancements to automate and modernize systems.

Qualifications:
A bachelor’s degree in Data science or related field, or Economics degree.
A minimum of 3 years of experience in business analysis or a related field.
Exceptional analytical and conceptual thinking skills.
The ability to influence stakeholders and work closely with them to determine acceptable solutions.
Proficient in SQL and/or other data query languages. Experience of handling large scale data with efficiency. Familiar with Python or R is a plus.
Excel/Google Sheets Proficiency.
Experience with data exploration and visualization like Looker, Tableau, PowerBI, etc. It is a plus if you can share a portfolio of clear, intuitive, and insightful visualizations.
Excellent documentation skills.
Experience creating detailed reports and giving presentations.
A track record of following through on commitments.
Excellent planning, organizational, and time management skills.

Compensation:
Based on the candidate’s experience, seniority, and location
$60,000-$65,000 annually
The total compensation package includes Annual Bonus, Health, Life, Dental, and Vision Insurance, 401(k) plan, Equity Sharing, Mental Health Stipend, Unlimited PTO, and Paid Parental Leave
We require Covid-19 vaccination. We will consider reasonable accommodations only for valid and documented medical reasons or sincerely held religious beliefs. We are an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, age, disability, gender identity, marital or veteran status, or any other protected class.

full_desc:
Position Summary/Position

Under the direction of the department leadership team, the Healthcare Data Analyst I (HDA) is responsible for providing technical, analytical, and reporting support for the Finance department to drive company key initiatives.
The HDA I must understand relational database concepts, table design and structure, joins, data normalization, and data types. In addition to technical data concepts, the HDA I must have an understanding of medical and economic factors/drivers of medical costs and utilization, and familiarity with data architecture for health care reporting. Major Functions (Duties and Responsibilities)

1. Develops and prepares reports to support the department in healthcare data analyses, utilizing available tools, including but not limited to Microsoft Office suite, SSRS, SAS, Power BI, IEHP system-specific BI reporting tools, or other related reporting.
2. Exercises timely and accurate data mining techniques and develops new or modifies existing reports that ensure consistent conclusions to data analysis.
3. Use analytical skills to determine solutions and resolve problems.
4. Responsible for evaluating report requests to determine requestor’s needs and objectives, identifying correct methodology for extracting data including data sources and criteria, and ensuring the delivered report is accurate, timely, and formatted appropriately.
5. Significant participation in analysis, interpretation, and translating of complex health plan data, issues, trends, and relationships into effective strategies and action plans.
6. Responsible for managing assigned projects and effectively communicating with the leadership team any project deadlines that may be in jeopardy of being met, well in advance of the due date.
7. Document all analysis / reporting projects following established protocols, ensuring replication of results by an independent reviewer.
8. Demonstrate a commitment to incorporate LEAN principles into daily work.
9. Establish and maintain effective working relationships with others throughout the organization.
10. Perform special projects and other duties as assigned by the department leadership team. Major Functions (Duties and Responsibilities) Cont Supervisory Responsibilities Leading: Self Experience Qualifications

Three (3) years of relevant experience.
In lieu of experience, a Master’s degree will be accepted. Preferred Experience Education Qualifications

Bachelor's degree from an accredited institution required. Preferred Education

Master’s degree from an accredited institution preferred. Professional Certification Professional Licenses Drivers License Required No Knowledge Requirement

Working knowledge of data analysis, financial models, and preparing professional documents. Basic understanding of statistical methods. Working knowledge of Microsoft Access, SQL, SAS, or other equiv. data program language are essential. Skills Requirement

Data analysis, data presentation, spread sheet and database capabilities. Proficiency in Microsoft Excel, Word, and PowerPoint. Excellent interpersonal/communication skills. Abilities Requirement

Strong problem-solving capability. Strong attention to detail. Ability to handle multiple projects. Commitment to Team Culture

The IEHP Team environment requires a Team Member to participate in the IEHP Team Culture. A Team Member demonstrates support of the Culture by developing professional and effective working relationships that include elements of respect and cooperation with Team Members, Members and associates outside of our organization. Working Conditions

Position is eligible for telecommuting/remote work location model upon completing the necessary steps and receiving HR approval. The incumbent approved to telecommute may periodically be required to report to IEHP’s main campus for mandatory in-person meetings or for other business needs determined by IEHP leadership. Work Model Location Telecommute Physical Requirements Hearing: One-on-One - FREQUENTLY Communicate: Information/ideas verbally - FREQUENTLY Near Visual Acuity - FREQUENTLY Keyboarding: 10-Key - FREQUENTLY Keyboarding: Touch-Screen - FREQUENTLY Keyboarding: Traditional - FREQUENTLY Sitting - CONSTANTLY Lighting - CONSTANTLY Indoors - FREQUENTLY Regular contacts: co-workers, supervisor - FREQUENTLY Memory - FREQUENTLY Understand and follow direction - FREQUENTLY Regular and reliable attendance - CONSTANTLY
A reasonable salary expectation is between $79,809.60 and $101,774.40, based upon experience and internal equity.
Inland Empire Health Plan (IEHP) is the largest not-for-profit Medi-Cal and Medicare health plan in the Inland Empire. We are also one of the largest employers in the region, designated as “Great Place to Work.” With a provider network of more than 5,000 and a team of more than 3,000 employees, IEHP provides quality, accessible healthcare services to more than 1.5 million members. And our Mission, Vision, and Values help guide us in the development of innovative programs and the creation of an award-winning workplace. As the healthcare landscape is transformed, we’re ready to make a difference today and in the years to come. Join our Team and make a difference with us! IEHP offers a competitive salary and stellar benefit package with a value estimated at 35% of the annual salary, including medical, dental, vision, team bonus, and state pension plan.

full_desc:
OGC is a boutique research and consulting agency specializing in data-driven strategy, quantitative analytics, and Customer Experience (CX) program design and optimization. We work with the world’s largest organizations to help them gain a deep understanding of their customers, develop actionable insights, and improve business processes.
We are seeking a full-time Data Analyst to join our Financial Services practice, and work closely with one of our key clients a leading financial services firm. In this role you’d be supporting in migrating SAS-powered processes to a Python-powered architecture. This will require thinking strategically about how the data and processes should be set-up with maintenance, usability and scalability in mind.
This role provides a great opportunity for a dynamic, self-starter to become part of a high-performing team driving business decisions that impact large and small companies around the world.
Responsibilities:
Support migration from SAS-powered to Python-powered architecture
Implement data standards and principles
Exhibit creative problem solving to navigate technical and logistical obstacles
Serve as the point of contact between American Express and OGC, pulling in the right support and generally ensuring project success.
Provide succinct updates to managers and clients

Bachelor’s degree in Business, Statistics, Computer Science, Social Science, or a related field
1-3 years experience in consulting, strategy, data analysis, CX, market research, or related field
Strong experience with Python
Experience with SAS/SQL (SAS strongly preferred)
Ability to think strategically about data architecture and process improvement with regards to maintenance, usability and scalability
Ability to learn new technological/analytical tools and methodologies quickly
Excellent attention to detail
Team player with exceptional communication skills
Ability to prioritize and coordinate multiple projects and requests
Capable of working both independently on projects and collaborating with a team

Description:

The Role & Requirements
We are looking for a Product Data Analyst to further our use of data to drive product decisions. You will work directly with our product team delivering insights into customer behavior, measuring results from product experiments, creating and validating hypotheses, and broadly helping shape the best experiences for customers that generate the highest value for the business.
As our Product Data Analyst you’ll get to:
Work with an amazing team of product managers, engineers, designers, and a broad set of stakeholders to provide essential insights into our products and customers
Mine data for insights, test and validate hypotheses about customer behavior and work with the team to recommend updates to the product to improve outcomes for both customers and the business
Establish key metrics and track progress against goals
Help improve product data processes and standardize best practices
Use data to understand behavior and identify areas for improvement
Create data visualizations to communicate insights to stakeholders and customers
Collaborate with engineering and our BI team to build scalable analytics infrastructure
Design and interpreting A/B tests to optimize product features
We’d love to meet someone who has…
Essential experience –
3+ years experience in product data analytics or data science, playing a key role in data gathering, data analysis and helping teams make data based decisions
Self-starter, with demonstrated success in using analytics to drive the understanding, growth, and success of a product
Strong hands-on experience with SQL and big data
Experience with data visualization and business intelligence tools (we use Snowflake, Looker, and Domo)
Experience with AB testing
Exceptional communication skills to help deliver insights to diverse stakeholders
Other must haves –
A “can do” proactive attitude – gets stuff done
Passion for providing data and analysis that product managers love
Detail oriented, outcome and process focused
Curiosity
Excellent verbal and written communication in English
Ability to build excellent relationships quickly across the company
Willingness to learn and personal desire to keep up to date with technology and process
Ability and confidence to raise concerns and issues
Requirements:
Essential experience –
3+ years experience in product data analytics or data science, playing a key role in data gathering, data analysis and helping teams make data based decisions
Self-starter, with demonstrated success in using analytics to drive the understanding, growth, and success of a product
Strong hands-on experience with SQL and big data
Experience with data visualization and business intelligence tools (we use Snowflake, Looker, and Domo)
Experience with AB testing
Exceptional communication skills to help deliver insights to diverse stakeholders

Position Summary:
Collaborate with university stakeholders to design and provide decision support for new initiatives in support of New York University’s mission. Utilize available data sources to design and develop statistical models to analyze past data and to predict future behavior. Provide quantitative analysis of various alternatives to ensure new initiatives meet operational goals. Utilize technical skills to extract and analyze data, and communication skills to present quantitative analysis to stakeholders.
Qualifications:
Required Education:
Bachelor's Degree

Preferred Education:
Master's Degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Statistics, Mathematics, Economics, Psychology, Sociology, Education, Business, or a related field.

Required Experience:
1+ years of experience with data collection, retrieval, analysis, and reporting in an applied context.

Preferred Experience:
2+ years with data warehousing/reporting in an institutional research environment.

Required Skills, Knowledge and Abilities:
Detail oriented and able to meet deadlines and manage multiple projects simultaneously. Proficiency with data analysis software a must (R, SPSS, Python, JMP or equivalent). Proficiency writing SQL to query databases and manipulate data; excellent written and verbal communication and presentation skills; experience using business intelligence tools (Tableau/Tableau Prep or equivalent).

Preferred Skills, Knowledge and Abilities:
Scripting/programming experience in R, SPSS, Python, JMP or equivalent strongly preferred. Consulting experience a plus. Familiarity with reporting requirements around Student Enrollment Records and Student Financial Aid. Proven ability to manage multiple priorities under hard deadlines while maintaining a high level of professionalism and exceptional attention to detail and accuracy.
Additional Information:
In compliance with NYC’s Pay Transparency Act, the annual base salary range for this position is $58,500 - $104,000. New York University considers factors such as (but not limited to) scope and responsibilities of the position, candidate’s work experience, education/training, key skills, internal peer equity, as well as market and organizational considerations when extending an offer.

NYU aims to be among the greenest urban campuses in the country and carbon neutral by 2040. Learn more at nyu.edu/nyugreen.

Position Summary:
As a Data Analyst on the Data Operations team, you will work cross-functionally with data engineers, data scientists, business experts, and external vendors to help National University deliver a better student experience by using data and analytics. You will work on a variety of projects that include building analytical models, coding, data visualizations, and storytelling to help us identify opportunities for our students, for our faculty and our staff. You will quickly become an expert in one of our key business and data domains (i.e., Learning, finance, financial aid, etc.) and work cross functionally in an analytics center of excellence to improve existing processes or analytical approaches.
The successful candidate will turn data into information, information into insight and insight into business decisions. Data analyst responsibilities include conducting full lifecycle analysis to include requirements, activities, and design. Data analysts will develop analysis and reporting capabilities. They will monitor performance and quality control plans to identify improvements.

Essential Functions:
Interpret data, analyze results using statistical techniques and provide ongoing reports
Develop and implement databases, data collection systems, data analytics and other strategies that optimize statistical efficiency and quality
Acquire data from primary or secondary data sources and maintain databases/data systems
Identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets
Utilizes various software applications and reporting tools to deliver actionable data to end-users in an understandable format
Build sophisticated data pipelines using SQL, Python, and internal workflow management tools to provide visibility to operational process
End-to-End manage data warehouse and reporting pipeline build
Manage stakeholder expectations and project manage design, development and delivery of data solutions, own data analysis where needed, and communicate the outcomes/insights to various collaborators to aid strategic decisions for improvements
Filter and “clean” data by reviewing computer reports, printouts, and performance indicators to locate and correct code problems
Work with management to prioritize business and information needs
Locate and define new process improvement opportunities

Supervisory Responsibilities:
No supervisor duties.
Requirements:
Education & Experience:
A Bachelor’s degree; preferably in Data Science, Computer Science, Statistics, Engineering, or other quantitative fields.
2 Years of experience in data analytics. Master’s degree in data analytics in lieu of experience.
Knowledge of statistics and experience using statistical packages for analyzing datasets (Excel, SPSS, SAS etc.)
Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy
Adept at queries, report writing and presenting findings
A demonstrated ability to query and extract findings from large data sets in relational databases such as SQL Server, Teradata, Oracle, etc.
Experience with programming/scripting languages like R or Python
Experience with advanced data visualization platforms such as Tableau
Competencies/Technical/Functional Skills:
Quick on feet; willingness to discover alternative solutions to technical problems.
A desire to solve complex problems with creative and concise solutions.
Excellent written and oral presentation skills – ability to communicate findings with non-technical stakeholders in concise and simple terms.
An individual who thrives in a collaborative environment.
Candidate receiving offers will be offered a salary/pay rate commensurate with experience that vary based on a candidate’s qualifications, skills, and competencies. Absent exceptional circumstances, candidates will be offered a salary within this range for this position. Base pay is one component of National University’s total rewards package, as we are dedicated to supporting the needs of the “whole you” with our holistic approach to employee benefits by offering comprehensive well-being benefits for you and your family. For full details about our benefit plan offerings, please visit
benefits.nu.edu
. For Part-time benefits, please click
here
.
Compensation Range:
Annual Salary: $63,720.00 - $86,020.00
National University is committed to maintaining a high-quality, diverse workforce representative of the populations we serve. National University employs more than 5,000 faculty and staff and serves over 41,000 students. We are united in our mission to meet the global education demands of the 21st Century and are dedicated to creating a supportive academic and work environment that allows students, faculty and staff to develop their interests and talents while experiencing a sense of community and a commitment to diversity. With programs available both online and at our many campus locations, National University is a leader in creating innovative solutions to education and meeting the needs of our diverse student population, including adult learners and working professionals.
National University offers an opportunity to work in an innovative environment that supports diversity.
National University (NU) is proud to be an equal opportunity employer and does not unlawfully discriminate against any employee or applicant for employee per applicable federal, state and local laws. At NU, a diverse mix of highly talented, innovative and creative people come together to make the impact of a lifetime for each of our student learners. All qualified applicants will receive equal consideration for employment, education, and admission at National University. We are focused on equality and believe deeply in diversity of race, color, ancestry, age, family care status, veteran status, marital status, creed, religion, sex, gender, sexual orientation, religion, ethnicity, national origin, and other legally protected group status.

full_desc:
Job Description:
The technical and business analyst is responsible for addressing advanced inquiries, requests for enhancements, and supporting B2B clients.
We are looking for an organized, detailed-oriented person that is adept at learning and supporting our world leading B2B software for automating complex 24 hour shift based scheduling of staff. This individual will gain familiarity with specific client instances of our cloud hosted software suite, be able to troubleshoot and dialogue with developers as needed to resolve client requests and inquiries. The selected candidate will develop an intimate knowledge of their assigned client base's usage of this system, via automated usage tracking forms, and maintain relationships with the relevant client POCs.
Under the guidance of senior staff:
map the workflows of the use of our products by customers
create user surveys to assess their difficulties and their readiness to use our products, and the level of training they may need
document result of regularly scheduled calls to clients to discover client feedback about the use of our software products and the level of satisfaction
create presentations of findings of clients to Management and to clients about ideas to optimize product performance and satisfaction including items ranging from custom product enhancements, configurations, to refresher training
participate in the delivery of product enhancements, from requirements gathering and specifications to working with the development team, business stakeholders, and client for a smooth delivery
respond to client inquiries in a timely manner
Qualifications:
Ideally have a background in computer science, economics or have some exposure to computer science and IT
Hold a degree from a reputable university, with a GPA of 3.0 or higher or have commensurate work experience
Proficiency in MS Excel and Visio (or like applications)
Programming knowledge is not required
We are looking for someone that lives within a reasonable distance from the office (an hour or less).

full_desc:
A pioneer in K–12 education since 2000, Amplify is leading the way in next-generation curriculum and assessment. Our core and supplemental programs in ELA, math, and science engage all students in rigorous learning and inspire them to think deeply, creatively, and for themselves. Our formative assessment products help teachers identify the targeted instruction students need to build a strong foundation in early reading and math. All of our programs provide educators with powerful tools that help them understand and respond to the needs of every student. Today, Amplify serves more than 10 million students in all 50 states. For more information, visit amplify.com.
Amplify is a leader in creating immersive, rigorous digital learning experiences that look great, play great, and help students expect great things of themselves. Amplify has been described as the best tech company in education, and the best education company in tech.
Engineering
As a member of the engineering organization at Amplify, you will join a dedicated team taking on the toughest problems in education with the best ideas in technology – including user experience, APIs and services, data analysis, and deployment pipelines. You’ll play an active role in inventing and improving product design and the classroom experience.
“Amplify’s COVID-19 vaccination policy requires all staff to provide proof of vaccination for in-person meetings unless an approved exemption is provided.”
What You’ll Do:
Our data analytics teams ingest, transform, model, and aggregate the data that empowers teams across Amplify and our customers to make sense of and tell stories with their data. You’ll be working with learning scientists and data engineers to deliver accurate and reliable reports, dashboards, models, metrics, and analysis for our products and internal business partners. We believe strongly in teaching our teammates to serve themselves, within a safe, reliable, and agile data environment. You’ll be building analytical solutions, but also the sharing-and-learning culture so that every team uses your analysis to improve their own lives, and those of our students and teachers.
Collaboration and Communication: Collaborate with internal business partners, data scientists, and data engineers to identify precise data requirements, define and refine metrics and clarify technical requirements. Effectively communicate status, risks, open questions and blockers across multiple projects in a fast-paced environment.
Data Analysis: Become an expert in the Amplify data models. Analyze data from various sources and communicate insights to executives, leaders and other key stakeholders.
Data Visualization: Design, build, and maintain intuitive, alluring data visualizations that provide critical visibility for all levels to lead and operate effectively. Write accompanying concise and accurate documentation.
Accurate and Consistent: Proactively identify inaccuracies in data. Determine and implement solutions to improve data quality. Collaborate with the data governance team to ensure consistency of key metrics.
Example Projects You Might Work On:
Improve calibration of customer support auditors through analyzing historic audit results, developing a calibration dashboard, and recommending an appropriate target to leadership.
Enhance the customer support case data model to allow for efficient analysis of the impact of one case type on another in partnership with data engineering.
Deliver professional development services more cost effectively by providing transparency to the true cost of delivery and related revenue. Analyze cost trends based on delivery method, geographic location, session type etc to identify and address biggest cost drivers.
Basic Requirements
2+ years of experience in a data science/analyst role; or related experience
Superb communication skills in writing and conversation, especially with non-technical partners
Extensive expertise using business intelligence and data visualization tools (Tableau, Looker), including proficiency in SQL
Familiarity with ETL/ELT pipelines and related tooling, understanding of relational data models and metric creation
A drive to understand data and key performance metrics and their relevance to our business and product decisions
Ability to learn and adopt new tools and methods
Strong analytical background and experience driving self-directed projects
Preferred Requirements
Demonstrable record of using data visualization best practices
Experience working with a cloud-based data warehousing and analytics stack (Airflow, dbt, Snowflake, AWS, Fivetran)
Proficient in a statistical or functional programming language (preferably python or R)
Understanding of ETL/ELT pipelines and Data Warehousing design, tooling, and support
Background in education or in edtech, or other fields with significant privacy, security, and compliance requirements
Experience building reports and analyzing data from company software, e.g., Netsuite, Hubspot, Salesforce etc.
Compensation:

The hourly rate range for this role is $34-$39.
We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. To that end, we seek to recruit, develop and retain the most talented people from a diverse candidate pool.
Amplify is an Equal Opportunity Employer of Minorities, Females, Protected Veterans and Individuals with Disabilities.

This position may be funded, in whole or in part, through American Recovery & Reinvestment Act funds.
Amplify Education, Inc. is an E-Verify participant.

Position Purpose: Steward is at the forefront of transitioning from volume to value-based care and has an established track record of success in managing the health risk of our populations. Steward Health Care Network (SHCN) is seeking motivated candidates with previous professional experience in software application support (ideally healthcare) and a strong desire to learn. The Application Analyst will be responsible for the day-to-day application systems support for population health applications utilized within SCHN. This position reports directly to the SH Product Manager, Provider and Member Applications.
Provide support for applications in use by Steward teams including Provider Enrollment, Patient Population, and executive leadership
Support SHCN application development lifecycle including implementation, training, change requests, integrations, and enhancements
Primary contact for application related support requests, user security and management
Constant evaluation of all current applications to suggest enhancement ideas, or identify defects and other inefficiencies
Facilitate communication between business stakeholders and technical development teams, and ensure appropriate teams are informed of any application update, modification, or defect resolution that impacts their work
Comfortable working independently on multiple projects by utilizing strong time-management skills
Use strong technical and analytical background to become proficient with new software applications
Able to analyze data to establish facts and draw valid conclusions to clearly define application-related enhancements, gaps, or defects
Able to schedule, track and perform routine maintenance tasks in multiple applications
Comfortable leading internal team training either in-person, or remotely through screenshare/headset audio
Familiarity with Quality Measure programs and/or Population Health is desirable

Education / Experience / Other Requirements


Education: Bachelors’ Degree preferred


Years of Experience:
1 - 3 years’ experience in an Analyst role within a health care organization
1 – 3 years’ experience in application support, troubleshooting, and direct end user and super user support
1 – 3 years’ experience managing end user access and documenting and/or following end user access policies
1 – 3 years’ experience with managing large populations of end users (internal and external) for multiple applications
1 – 3 years’ experience implementing applications (preferably in a health care organization)


Specialized Knowledge:
Prior project management experience with small to medium-sized projects
Apply strong writing and communication skills to maintain user-facing documentation, provide answers to frequently asked questions, create guides on application use, and document technical processes for a non-technical audience
Microsoft Office (Excel, PowerPoint, etc), Population Health-related applications desired (not required), Familiarity with Customer Relationship Management applications, Business Intelligence, analytics, and reporting Tools


Location: Corporate · 1301.72313 IS Ambulatory Systems
Schedule: Full Time, Day Shift, 8:00 am - 4:30 PM

full_desc:
How to Apply:
Applying on Indeed.com is NOT considered an official submission to this vacancy. Please apply by using the link below:
https://www.calcareers.ca.gov/CalHrPublic/Jobs/JobPosting.aspx?JobControlId=341234
The Final Filing Date for this position is 12/30/2022
Job Description and Duties:
This position is eligible for telework under California Government Code 14200 for eligible applicants residing in California.
Working at the Occupational Safety and Health Standards Board (Board) means much more than showing up for a job. You will collaborate with a team working on regulations that are vital to the health and safety of our community, work force, and the state. We recognize the strength in teamwork. We know that by encouraging collaboration and diversity, actively engaging with stakeholders, and fulfilling our mission to promote, adopt, and maintain reasonable and enforceable standards, will benefit our economy as a whole. Be part of a team that prides itself in making a difference for Californians.
The Board protects and improves the health and safety of working Californians by developing safety standards and regulations, providing consultation and recommendations on the more complex and highly sensitive proposed health regulations, and evaluating petitions to revise regulations as well as requests for permanent variances from safety orders.
Under the direction of the Staff Services Manager I, and led by the Chief Counsel of the Board, the Associate Governmental Program Analyst (AGPA) will independently perform a variety of complex, sensitive, and/ or varied analytical, administrative, and executive level duties, which require independence of action, analysis, political acumen, initiative, knowledge of departmental policies, good judgment, tact and diplomacy, and a thorough knowledge of appropriate office operations.
Desirable Qualifications:

Experienced in Microsoft Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and other office-based software programs.
