The Senior Analyst - FP&A is responsible for tracking financial performance of Maintenance Capital expense, forecasting, and variance analysis. Assists and supports short and long-term Maintenance Capital and O&M expense planning activities.
Essential Duties and Responsibilities:
Perform detailed variance analysis of actual financial results versus plan, forecast, and key performance metrics
Identify trends in variances and make recommendations for financial improvement and optimization to management

Who is Swire Coca-Cola? We are one of the largest bottlers of Coca-Cola and other beverage brands in America. Our 7,200 hardworking and passionate employees produce and distribute more than 50 brands and flavors across 13 states. We have as many careers as we have flavors, and regardless of which role you choose, you have a direct impact on Swire Coca-Cola, our products, and the communities we call home.
At Swire Coca-Cola, our commitment to excellence is what guides our actions with our employees. We offer a comprehensive benefits package for full-time associates which includes: Medical, Dental, Vision, 401K, Paid Vacation, Paid Holidays and Company Discounts.

The Anaplan Technical Support Analyst will help Swire Coca-Cola USA build best in class tools and capabilities that support enterprise-wide planning and execution. The mission of the Anaplan Technical Support Analyst will be to own the solution design and deployment of our Anaplan models to drive efficiency and top line growth.

Responsibilities:
Support the solution design of Swire’s Anaplan model landscape. You will ensure the overall direction is optimized for space constraints, speed, maintainability, and user satisfaction
Participate UAT testing and deployment
Support and maintain high performance and scalable Anaplan model architecture
Support user groups to ensure solutions incorporate user feedback and the best decisions on design trade-offs are reached
Maintain knowledge of industry trends and utilize this knowledge to educate both IT and the business on opportunities to build better Anaplan target architectures that support RGM, Commercial, Supply Chain, HR, and Finance objectives
Develop model documentation
Qualifications & Requirements:
BS or BA degree in Finance, Accounting, Business, Technology, Information Systems, or equivalent degree
At least 2 years of Anaplan or similar model building experience
Understanding of data architecture and integration across platforms
Excellent communication skills and experience with stakeholder influencing and project management
Understanding of end-to-end processes and data models, in planning (i.e., sales, finance, commercial, supply chain, workforce, etc.), forecasting, execution, and Trade Promotion Management
Strong Excel analytical capability (Pivot tables, macros) and Access familiarity
Strong conceptual, strategic thinking, problem solving, technical and analytical skills
Preferred
Experience in agile development practices including leadership of user feedback groups
Preferred 3 years of Anaplan model building experience
Technical Skill (Preferred):
Subject matter expertise in planning and modeling in Supply Chain, Retail, Finance, or Sales Performance Management
Advanced Microsoft Excel / financial modeling skills
Hands-on experience with Power BI
Master Anaplan Certification - An Anaplan Certified Solution Architect is an individual who has shown technical competence at the required level via successful completion of all courses that make up the Anaplan Platform Certification Path [To be considered for the Anaplan Certified Solution Architect achievement, candidates must successfully complete the curriculum as well as submit a Design Review application and fulfill an experience requirement].
Technical Skill (Required):
Demonstrated knowledge of a formal system implementation methodology – requirements gathering, design, build/test and deploy (Agile methodology preferable)
A minimum of 2 years’ experience in design, building and implementation of any of the qualifying software below.
Oracle Hyperion HFM, Oracle Hyperion Planning, Oracle Cloud EPM
SAP BPC, SAP IBP, SAP BI-IP, SAP SAC, SAP Callidus
Leadership Behaviors:
Generate new or unique solutions and embrace new ideas that help sustain our business
Collaborate with system, customers, and other stakeholders: Develop and leverage relationships with stakeholders to appropriately stretch and impact the System (Franchise Partners and Bottlers).
Take calculated risks – be willing to do things differently and drive others to adopt better ways of meeting our objectives
Swire Coca-Cola is an equal employment opportunity and affirmative action employer that participates in the E-Verify program as required by law. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, Veteran status or other legally protected characteristics.

full_desc:
ABOUT LeaseLock:
In a perfect world, every lease would end with zero balance. Properties and tenants could go their separate ways without squabbling over outstanding debts and deposits. Those debts and deposits make up hundreds of millions of dollars each year and most of it is just forfeited— languishing in escrow, sent to collections, or simply written off as bad debt.
At LeaseLock, we believe in a better way. We’re empowering the built world with better technology and equipping property owners and operators with a new generation of financial tools to reduce risk, recapture revenue, and optimize asset performance. Our financial technology creates more valuable, efficient properties by turning unpredictable loss and damage into dependable operating income, getting each lease closer to zero balance.
Powered by our data platform and AI risk engine, LeaseLock develops solutions, like our flagship lease insurance, that are driving the future of residential rental real estate. Launched in 2016 and growing rapidly, we’ve insured over $6 billion in leases with clients representing the top property management companies and ownership groups in the country.

ROLE SUMMARY:
In this role you are expected to be a critical thinker and to own the entire data flow of our system. You will be a part of the product organization and will work closely with product managers and analysts. During your first 90 days, you will be focused on the data quality and accuracy for our top client. You will be expected to dive into the data, find existing data accuracy issues and determine the root cause for the inaccuracies. You will then be responsible for creating and executing a repeatable process that can be performed daily for continuous monitoring of data accuracy. Long term, the successful candidate will be an integral part of informing our product and data migration strategy by identifying the key points where data accuracy breaks down and recommending potential long term solutions.

RESPONSIBILITIES:
You will be responsible for ensuring data flows properly through the entire data lifecycle; data integration, data processing, certificate creation and reporting.
Monitor and manage data quality processes and data integrations
Responsible for the data quality of certificate management
Identify problems and determine root cause for proper hand off to the development team
Responsible for expectation reporting and proper resolution
Establish and document processes and procedures
Surface qualitative and quantitative data to inform decision making and measure the impact of the work delivered by the team

QUALIFICATIONS:
Bachelor’s degree
2-3 years of experience with data and/or operations analysis experience.
Prefer experience within the Insurance industry, Property Management Companies, and/or Property Management software companies.
Experience working with databases, SQL and python is a must.
Critical thinking and ability to clearly articulate the problems within data sets is required daily.
Must be meticulously organized and excited by focusing on and fixing the smallest inaccuracies.
This is not a client facing role, but your ability to partner with internal stakeholders in a positive and predictual fashion will be required for success.

COMMON QUESTIONS
What is the pay range for this position?
Our pay ranges are wide to allow for adjustment based on relevant experience and geo-location; those with less experience and in a lower cost location can expect to land lower in the range; those with more experience and in a higher cost location can expect to land higher in the range.
The base pay range for this position is $54,000 - $100,000 annually.
Our offers also include a corporate or incentive bonus target and early stage stock option equity.
Will this position have direct reports?
No
Where does this role report?
Reports into our Director, Product Management
Where is this role located?
We are a remote first organization, so we are fine with anyone located within the United States working remotely from their current residence.
Do you accept applicants on a Work Visa?
We are happy to accept applicants who currently hold a valid work visa that has at least 3+ years of work authorization left.

You will thrive on autonomy, identify opportunities, and be passionate about taking our analytics capabilities to the next level through practical and structured approaches to data dissemination, visualization, and modeling. full_desc:
Would you like to be part of a fast-moving SaaS team?

Would you like the flexibility to work at our HQ in Cottage Grove, MN or Remote?

If the answers are YES!, this job may be for you.

Travelnet Solutions team is searching for our “go-to” person for reporting and analytics within the Sales Team. We’re looking for someone who is intellectually curious, enjoys numbers and tells a story with the numbers. You’ll use your systems knowledge and analytical skills to find business opportunities in the data and collaborate with internal partners including our business development and strategy teams. This position will report directly to the Sales Operations Manager.

This is the job for you if you are:

Self-starter with tremendous initiative and work ethic

Excellent communicator and collaborator with other functional teams

Desire to be a high-impact player at a product-driven company

Ability to embrace change and someone who is a fast learner

Creative and critical thinking abilities

Ability to be detail oriented within a high-paced environment

Passionate about technology

About the TravelNet Solutions Team:

Our mission is transforming how hospitality works. Every day we strive to solve the most difficult technology and workflow challenges, and we collaborate to provide solutions to help our customers in the hospitality industry become more efficient and profitable. Our goal is to become our customer's business concierge. It all starts with one question; how can we help you?

Our three Core Values reflect the behaviors that shape the tone of how we work with each other, our partners, and our customers.

Serve Others: We nurture growth to help others succeed.

Grit: We take ownership and never give up on what matters most.

Create the Future: We innovate to disrupt the status quo.

Why join our winning team?

We are a growing, fast-moving dynamic team that collaborates with each other in order to achieve continued growth and success.

We are a portfolio company able to work with our customers to be that one vendor solution for SaaS technology, marketing, and distribution.

We are reshaping the industry and the way it thinks about technology and service.

Full medical dental and vision package

Unlimited Paid Time Off

Health Savings Account with up to a $2,000 annual match

Flexible work environment

Free life insurance and Long Term Disability

Free Lunch on Mondays either in Cottage Grove or through Door Dash

Complimentary Door Dash Pass account

Availability of Flex Spending Accounts

Retirement with employer match

Free snacks and soda in the office

Competitive wages

Work with an amazing team

Do these responsibilities describe what you like doing?

Acquire data from primary or secondary data sources and maintain databases/data systems

Identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets

Filter and “clean” data by reviewing computer reports, printouts, and performance indicators to locate and correct code problems

Work with management to prioritize business and information needs

Locate and define new process improvement opportunities

Using automated tools to extract data from primary and secondary sources

Developing and maintaining databases, data systems – reorganizing data in a readable format

Performing analysis to assess quality and meaning of data

Assigning numerical value to essential business functions so that business performance can be assessed and compared over periods of time.

Preparing reports for the management stating trends, patterns, and predictions using relevant data

Managing master data, including creation, updates, and deletion.

Managing users and user roles.

Provide quality assurance of imported data, working with quality assurance analysts if necessary.

Supporting initiatives for data integrity and normalization.

Assessing tests and implementing new or upgraded software and assisting with strategic decisions on new systems.

Generating reports from single or multiple systems.

Troubleshooting the reporting database environment and reports.

Training end-users on new reports and dashboards.

Collaborate with team members to collect and analyze data

Use graphs, infographics and other methods to visualize data

Establish KPIs to measure the effectiveness of business decisions

Structure large data sets to find usable information

Work with a team of analysts and other associates to process information

What are some must-haves?

Salesforce experience and knowledge

Advanced Excel skills (including pivot tables, vlookups, data modeling, etc.)

Experience using G-Suite (Gmail, Sheets, etc.)

Analytical and problem-solving skills

Ability to set and meet deadlines

Ability to work in high-pressure situations

Reporting and data visualization skills

Excellent attention to detail

Proven working experience as a Data Analyst or Business Data Analyst, or a related field.

Technical expertise regarding data models, database design development, data mining and segmentation techniques

Ability to analyze existing tools and databases and provide software solution recommendations.

Demonstrated experience in handling large data sets and relational databases.

High-level written and verbal communication skills.

Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy

Adept at queries, report writing and presenting findings


We are an Equal Opportunity Employer

We celebrate the diversity of thought, culture, and background and we are committed to creating an inclusive environment.

full_desc:
Department Overview:
The PBM Business Data Analyst provides support to OHSU Pharmacy Benefit Management Services. Support includes but is not limited to file development and transmission, report development and maintenance, testing of benefit configurations, data analysis and translation, and enhancement of existing systems.

This position gathers, compiles, analyzes and provides qualitative and quantitative information and statistical data, and presents this information in narrative or schematic form for use in business planning and administrative decision making.

This is the second of a three level series. The PBM Business Data Analyst is distinguished from the lower level by providing analysis of the data, advanced technical skills in report writing and by providing recommendations for business outcomes from the analyzed data.

This position is elegiable for Telecommuting
Function/Duties of Position:
Business Analysis and Development.
Gathers and compiles raw data from a variety of sources for business research information.
Gathers data, and analyzes results. Develops survey instruments.
Identifies or calculates statistically valid samples.
Verifies the accuracy of survey reports with survey respondents, and organizes and analyzes data in printouts, tables, graphs, and charts.
Applies elementary statistical tests to data to estimate trends.
Participates with information systems staff in designing and implementing new or enhanced information systems.
Report Generation
Oversees and ensures the appropriate formatting, content and production of regular and ad hoc reports.
Extracts data from computer printouts and applies software (e.g., statistical, word processing, spreadsheet, presentation, and database) to the analysis and reporting of findings.
Uses computer report generator language software packages or writes routine programs to retrieve, edit, and tabulate data from various databases and files.
Displays and maintains data in graphs, summary tables, and charts.
Interprets researched information. Writes reports, such as summaries of statistical studies, narrative reports and articles for publication, including summary tables, graphs, and charts.
Produces tables of estimates and other special reports.
Summarizes data into various formats and writes short reports, or sections of major reports.
Business Consulting:
Provides consultation and assists managers and leaders in the use of analytical and reporting tools to develop effective cost, quality and satisfaction outcomes.
Provides recommendations based on information produced.
Participates in and may facilitate work groups and committees.
Answers requests for information relating to subjects within the OHSU business areas.
Contacts businesses, governmental officials, and others to collect and interpret data.
Reviews reports, papers, memos and articles of staff to ensure proper use of data and offer consultation.
Project Management:
May provide a limited amount of project management and may oversee and/or train staff.
Reviews project work of lower-level Business Data Analysts, technicians and support staff for accuracy and completeness.
Provides training on survey methods and other job functions to lower-level analysts or support staff.
Required Qualifications:
Education:

full_desc:
NextGen Practice Management and billing experience
NextGen EMR / EPM Ambulatory Senior Analyst (Remote)
Requirements:
Senior NextGen Ambulatory EPM / EMR Application Analyst is responsible for systems analysis, process / workflow optimization, software implementation, and support for applications maintained by the Health Information Technology department.
Also, responsible for supporting essential application functions, performing system configuration tasks, resolving problems, performing system upgrades and patching, and meeting all customer expectations for clinical and business applications.
Serving as a liaison between end users' workflow needs and NextGen development staff. Acting as the primary support contact for the application's end-users
Identifying issues that arise in their application area as well as issues that impact other application teams, and working to resolve them
Guiding workflow design, building and testing the system, and analyzing other technical issues associated with Epic software
Working with NextGen representatives, organization's business community, and end-users to ensure the system meets the organization's business needs in regards to the project deliverables and timeline
Participating in training and working with end users; Troubleshooting problems and questions
Supports the EMR implementation process, including planning, design, development, implementation, communication, maintenance, and evaluation of existing or new functionality to ensure efficient processes/workflows.
Gathers and analyzes data in support of business cases, proposed projects, and systems requirements.
Responsible for generating and compiling reports based on the findings, complete with probable causes and possible solutions to systems issues.
Mentor, lead and direct the work of others when applicable. An extensive degree of creativity and latitude is expected.
Qualifications:
Required at least 3 years’ experience working with NextGen Ambulatory EMR / EPM supporting clinical and business workflows.
Minimum of seven years of experience supporting technology systems. Minimum of five years of experience working in healthcare or another related field.
Experience supporting application configurations for Optimizations, Upgrades, and Enhancements for relevant application use in both single and multi-provider Ambulatory practices.
Proven experience with system analysis and system administration, balancing operational, maintenance, and customer expectations related to the needs and capabilities of the NextGen Ambulatory EHR Application.
Working knowledge of industry-standard message formats (e.g., HL7, X12, and XML), supporting application-specific workflows involving diagnostic orders and results (CPOE), as well as electronic prescriptions (e-prescribe).
Practical knowledge of importing data for use in reporting software, spreadsheets, graphs, flow charts, and visual process mapping (e.g., workflow diagrams).
Significant experience troubleshooting reported issues impacting assigned applications from both a technical and end-user training perspective.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills. Strong interpersonal skills and ability to communicate effectively with all levels of staff. Self-motivated and flexible to accommodate changes in clinical and business strategies. Detail-oriented, with a desire and ability to learn quickly. Strong organizational skills. Demonstrated ability to work productively in teams and independently. Strong analytical skills, including a thorough understanding of how to interpret clinical and business needs and translate them into application and operational requirements. Ability to effectively prioritize and execute multiple tasks in a high-pressure environment. Customer-service oriented.
Preferred Experience:
SAFe Agile experience is preferred
Knowledge of Mirth Connect and Mirth Result a big plus
Knowledge of Electronic Health Records Systems, Health Care Specific Data Interface standards, and health information exchange technologies a big plus
Minimum of two years of experience working as an end-user for user roles supported by assigned application(s) (i.e., working as an Ambulatory Medical Assistant (MA), Practice Administrator (Office Manager), Front Desk Registration and Scheduling, or in-office Biller/Coder for practice-based healthcare professional services). Experience with NextGen EPM.
Education Required:
· Bachelor's Degree from an accredited college or university. Or, equivalent job experience.
· Preferred areas of study include but are not limited to Health Sciences, Computer Sciences, Information Technology, or Business Management.
Licensure/Certifications:
· NextGen Certified Professional is preferred

Remote

full_desc:
Job Description
The Senior BI Analyst is responsible for creating accurate and timely reporting and data analysis for the entirety of our organization. The responsibilities include reporting (SSRS/Power BI), data loading and export (SSIS), data warehousing (SSAS), and ad-hoc analyses using T-SQL on data involving all aspects of the pharmacy industry. The Senior BI Analyst will design and implement new data warehouses, data warehouse related ETL processes, and plan application migration to new datasets with minimal supervision or technical oversight. The Senior BI Analyst will have an expert understanding of the data in the pharmacy industry and extensive experience in maintaining robust ETL processes in a production environment.
Senior IT positions are expected to participate in the mentoring and training of junior staff. They are also expected to execute good project management for long running projects and initiatives with little managerial oversight. Senior positions will be expected to coordinate multi-member and cross domain projects on a regular basis.
Essential Job Functions
Create and maintain SSRS/ Power BI reports
Distribute reports for various business segments
Design, Implement, and maintain advanced ETL processes
Ad-hoc analyses via SQL queries as needed
Tune and troubleshoot performance including TSQL, Indexes, and process
Assists software developers in designing queries
Design, implement, and maintain data warehouses
Design, implement, and maintain self-service BI services
Train end users in consuming self-service BI services
Compile and write documentation of process development following established methods so others can understand the process.
Write or contribute to instructions and manuals following documentation standards to guide end users.
Report status, issues, and timelines to management staff and project teams.
Follow established guidelines for source code revision control, coding standards, and release procedures.
Work independently
Manage their projects
Healthcare, human services and pharmacy domain experience
Additional Responsibilities
Perform other duties and projects as required by management.
Minimum Qualifications for Consideration
7+ years experience in data analytics, data science, or SQL programming
Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:
SSIS package advanced ETL design/build/deployment/support
BI Xpress task factory components
SSRS/ Power BI reporting (drill through, linked reports, sub reports)
Advanced TSQL (stored procedure build/support, functions, pivot, views, median’s, cross apply)
MS Expert
Data mart design (fact/dimension, tabular, cubes)
Tabular model prototyping, Power Pivot
Data visualization Power View, Power Map
Advanced understanding of Medi-Span and NDC/GPI and pricing methodologies
Therapeutic classes, drug status, package size calculations
Advanced understanding of NCPDP D.0 and 835 5010
File structure, segments and relationships
Advanced understanding of Reimbursement methodologies
Cost based methodologies as it relates to supply and demand in the market
PD response process
Advanced understanding of reimbursement methodologies
LTC, compounding, CO/B, DME and Medicare cross over
DIR fees PLB adjustments
Advanced understanding of acquisition cost methodologies
Inventory statuses NDC vs LGPI vs PGPI, generic programs
AWP purchase discounts
Physical requirements/Working Conditions
This work is sedentary and requires the following physical activities:
Sitting for long periods of time; occasional bending, squatting, kneeling, stooping; good finger dexterity and feeling; frequent repetitive motions; talking, hearing, and visual acuity.
Frequent lifting (up to 20 pounds of paper supplies or minor office equipment).
Driving to client locations and other sites as needed.
NOTE: The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work performed by an employee in this position. These statements are not to be construed as an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties, and skills required of employees in this position.

Summary:
Operations Analyst manages the effectiveness of reporting processes, conducts analysis, makes recommendations, develops documentation/standard work, coordinates and trains implementation of approved processes. Operations Analyst provides solutions and analysis for Channel Managers by performing a variety of tasks and projects as required by management to support driving quality sales. In addition, they research customer account data, missing sales, process vendor payments, and look for process improvements.

Ask the “why’s”, takes ownership of issues and will search to find the root cause to help avoid issues downstream

Proficiency in developing PowerBI dashboards

Knowledge of the deregulated utility industry is a plus.

Ability to use phone handset (headset optional)

full_desc:
Company Overview
We’re Lumos, a provider of 100% Fiber Optic Internet, Total Home Wi-Fi, voice and streaming services across North Carolina and Virginia. We believe that the possibilities of tomorrow cannot be built on the infrastructure of yesterday. That’s why we’re building a 100% Fiber Optic network from the ground up for families, small businesses and communities, backed by local, expert customer service. An Internet built for that most hopeful of all things- the future. Because whatever the future holds, we make it faster.

We are more than your average internet company. Our customers enjoy the fastest fiber speeds available built on a network they can truly count on – all backed by local, expert customer care teams. We know that fast, reliable Internet is what our customers need to stay connected to the things that matter. That continuous connection is our commitment to our community.

The Position
The Data Analyst II will assist in the process of data collection and analysis. The ideal candidate should have a data-driven, business-oriented mindset in data analytics, including mining, cleansing, and visualization to transform data into goal-oriented reports that drive innovation and growth. In conjunction with business analyst and product owners, the data analyst will work closely with leaders across care, marketing, product, sales, engineering and IT to support and implement high-quality, data-driven decisions.

Duties & Responsibilities: Data and Reporting functions:
Supporting initiatives for data integrity and normalization
Generating reports from single or multiple systems
Providing quality assurance and tagging of data.
Helping develop reports and analysis.
Managing master data, including creation, updates, and deletion.
Managing and designing the reporting environment, including data sources, security, and metadata.
Supporting the data warehouse in identifying and revising reporting requirements.
Assessing Tests and Implementing new or upgraded software and assisting with strategic decisions on new systems.
Troubleshooting/Problem Solving:
Troubleshooting the reporting database environment and reports.
Evaluating changes and updates to source production systems.
Thinking Ahead:
Anticipating future demands of initiatives related to people, technology, budget and business.
Designing/implementing solutions to meet these needs.
General:
Ensures accuracy of data and deliverables with comprehensive policies and processes.
Adheres to regular and predictable attendance and punctuality.
Performs other duties as assigned.
Qualifications
College degree and/or equivalent combination of education and work experience in related field required.
Minimum of 3-5 years’ experience with large datasets and various reporting tools such as Microsoft Power BI, Tableau, or Einstein Analytics. Experience writing or updating basic scripts for data extraction and analysis. Proven experience in BI and Analytics. Knowledge of industry standards recommended. It’s a plus if you are familiar with agile development processes.
Key Competencies:
The right candidate will also be proficient and experienced with the following tools/programs:
Expertise with Excel, Word, and PowerPoint.
Experience with Microsoft SQL Server.
Experience with analytics tools (Power BI).
Ability to quickly learn additional platforms as needed.
Working knowledge of data mining principles: predictive analytics, mapping, collecting data from multiple data systems on premises and cloud-based data sources.
Synthesizes complex or diverse information; Collects and researches data; Uses intuition and experience to complement data.
Benefits: Includes Medical, Dental, and Vision insurance, 401K, Tuition Reimbursement, Gym Reimbursement, Paid vacation/holiday leave and more.

We are proud to be an EEO/AA employer M/F/D/V. We maintain a drug-free workplace and perform pre-employment substance abuse testing.

Description:
Who We Are
Behind every one of our solutions is our greatest asset: our people. At Powernet, we are driven in our individual roles and by our collective goals - both in our work and in the community. Through our collaborative culture and spirit of innovation, Powernet offers a welcoming work environment that aligns professional and personal growth with real business results, a combination that can benefit anyone looking to take the next step in their career.
Who You Are
As an experienced business analyst, you specialize in gathering critical information necessary for building and maintaining software requirement documents. Your strong communication and interpersonal skills allow you to serve as an effective liaison between development staff and end-users, ensuring that the end product meets both user and system needs. You are adept at translating complex technical information into user-friendly language for stakeholders at all levels of an organization. Your attention to detail, analytical mindset, and ability to think strategically make you a valuable asset to any team.

Support and promote the mission, values, and principles of Powernet.
Create software requirement documentation
Schedule meetings to discuss and gather requirement information

Frequently assist billing analyst with day-to-day billing functions
Run processes as needed to maintain QA environment data
Requirements:
Associate degree or 2+ years related experience
Strong written and oral communication
Strong interpersonal and organizational skills
Experience using MS Word and MS Excel
SQL experience a plus
Self-motivated and goal oriented

The Senior Analyst - FP&A is responsible for tracking financial performance of Maintenance Capital expense, forecasting, and variance analysis. Assists and supports short and long-term Maintenance Capital and O&M expense planning activities.

The Opportunity
We are looking to add a Senior Data Analyst to Mindful Care. This is a highly visible role where you will bring your analytical skills and expertise to the organization. You will work with leaders in the company to help them build meaningful dashboards and provide valuable information for strategic decision making.
Responsibilities
The primary objectives of the role are listed below:
Extract and cross-reference data from our various sources such DrChrono, Active Campaign, and GA4 to enable insights such as # of patients who seek (and receive) same day/next day care, discharge status, diagnosis, and use of certain cpt codes.
Manage the collection of business and technical requirements from Stakeholders to deliver data driven solutions. Produces technical documentation that is consistent with professional standards.
Engage in data exploration using various programming languages (SQL, Python, R) requiring advanced knowledge of multiple database structures.
Collect, clean, analyze, visualize, and interpret data to glean insights, and develop appropriate business recommendations.
Research and analyze data flow across complex data ecosystem including operational and analytical data platforms.
Serve as an expert resource supporting data questions and issues from stakeholders across the organization (Clinical, Finance, Marketing & Sales) and providing data solutions.
Candidate Profile
5+ years’ experience as a Data Analyst in a corporate environment working cross functionally and with executives
2+ years’ experience working in a data analytical role in healthcare, preferably with in-network payor or provider in the mental health space
Proficiency with SQL programming, Azure data warehouse, and Metabase
Excellent analytical skills , able to identify trends and patterns from large and multi-dimensional data sets
Quantitative, analytical, and problem-solving skills
Excellent communication skills both written and verbal
Ability to learn quickly and take direction
Must be able to effectively work in an ambiguous environment with frequently changing priorities, deadlines, and workloads with minimal frustration
Able to prioritize, meet deadlines, and provide excellent service for multiple internal internal and external customers
Salary & Benefits
The base salary range for this position is $80,000 - $115,000 (DOE). In addition to a base salary, this position is eligible for benefits (subject to eligibility requirements) listed here: medical, dental, vision, 401(k), PTO, and company holidays to name a few. Total compensation is based on several factors including, but not limited to, type of position, location, education level, work experience, and certifications. This information is applicable for all full-time positions.

Regular Full-time, Exempt

Job Duties
Under close supervision of the Staff Services Manager I of the Contracts Office, the Staff Services Analyst (SSA) analyzes and coordinates the development of contracts for the department. The SSA aids with oversight, evaluation and technical support and process a range of different types of contracts including, interagency, Local Assistance, and service.
Desirables
Knowledge of State Contracting Manual and State Administrative Manual
Knowledge of the principles of sustainability
Detail Oriented
Self-motivated with a degree of independence
Strong writing and analytical skills
Ability to organize and establish simultaneous workload priorities
Ability to work well as a part of a team
Proficient use of Microsoft Office programs (Word, Outlook, Excel, PowerPoint)
Promotes a respectful and cooperative work environment
Demonstrates strong ability as an active listener
Excellent customer service skills
Essential Functions
Analyze and process new, draft, final, and amendment to the less complex contract agreement packages including various contract forms, law and policy citation exhibits, contractor instructional attachments, award documentation, and other material needed for determining legal sufficiency and policy compliance. Review items that appear incomplete, inadequate, and fail to substantially comply with contract policies and return materials to Department staff with constructive correction instructions. Assist Department staff in the development, completion or correction of contract forms and exhibits and respond to Draft and Final contract status inquiries while working closely with unit manager on related issues and workload progress.
Review, evaluate, and process service contracts ensuring that the purpose, terms and conditions, funding authority and data conform, align with the requirement of State and Federal contract laws, respectively. This includes decisions on the appropriate bidding method, contract solicitation, inputting applicable bids and registering contracts into Cal eProcure portal in compliance with Fi$Cal requirements per California Government Code Section 15849.22 (b) (1). Research, interpret, develop, and communicate contract laws, regulations, policies, and procedures appearing in various resources including the California Government Code, California Code of Regulations, Public Contract Code, State Administrative Manual, State Contracting Manual, and applicable Executive Orders and Management Memos. Assist with consultations to Department management and staff by providing technical expertise and training in areas of service contracts.
Analyze the less complex HCD 619's Purchase Requisitions, solicit requests for quotes in writing from vendors; analyze data to determine which supplier is able to meet all business and delivery requirements; create purchase orders, conduct peer reviews to ensure purchases are compliant and in accordance with HCD and State purchasing policies, procedures and sound business practices. Coordinate with other applicable Administrative staff and internal resources (i.e. Accounting, Budget Office, etc.) to obtain assistance or resolve concerns. Assist in trouble shooting problem contracts returned unapproved by the Department of General Services (DGS) and coordinate needed corrections with Department staff. Prepare rebuttals and responses to DGS contract return notices.
Maintain contract analyst workload spreadsheet logs and required entries to Fi$Cal and the Department database, Consolidated Automated Program Enterprise System (CAPES). Conduct necessary research to follow-up on contracts that become stalled in the development or approval process. Research and gather information to complete special projects related to contracts as assigned.
Provide back up to other contract/procurement analysts; work on special assignments on an as-needed basis. Perform other duties as assigned
Job Type: Full-time
Pay: $3,534.00 - $5,744.00 per month

General information
All posting locations: USA-IL, , United States of America
Job Function: 09 - HR
Date Published: 28-Mar-2023

Description & Requirements
HR Analyst Support Functions
The HR Analyst role will work with Human Resources to help support crucial routines and strategic HR projects within P&P- Legal and Communications.
Essential Functions & Responsibilities
35% – Responsible for day-to-day Supporting Career Development- Capability Building- Leadership Development- Employee Engagement- and Process Improvement initiatives
25% - Work closely with the HR Business Partners to advance the HR strategy for the respective business functions
15% – Coordinate and handle people budget to deliver on Annual Operating Plan financials
15% – Analyze data and optimally coordinate and present findings to drive data-backed HR strategy
15% – Responsible for Workday HR data changes and approval to ensure accuracy and compliance
10% – Support submitting and tracking approvals within HR systems and owning weekly data accuracy checks and updates in HRIS system
Encouraged Experience & Required Skills
Detail Oriented
Strong time management- analytical and interpersonal skills
MS Suite experience – specifically Excel
Experience with or ability to learn SharePoint and Workday to handle security permissions- modify the site- and update content
Work Environment & Schedule
This position is considered a normal office environment with limited travel or visits to external locations; offices are open workspaces Additionally; this role requires a Monday through Friday workweek.
Physical Requirements
Physical demands include but not limited to:
Constant keyboard or text input
This job description is not crafted to cover or contain all duties or responsibilities that are required of the role and may change or be added with or without notice.
About Us
The Kraft Heinz Company is one of the largest food and beverage companies in the world, with eight $1 billion+ brands and global sales of approximately $25 billion. We’re a globally trusted producer of high-quality, great-tasting, and nutritious foods for over 150 years. Our brands are truly global, with products produced and marketed in over 40 countries. These beloved products include condiments and sauces, cheese and dairy, meals, meats, refreshment beverages, coffee, infant and nutrition products, and numerous other grocery products in a portfolio of more than 200 legacy and emerging brands.
No matter the brand, we’re united under one vision: To sustainably grow by delighting more consumers globally. Bringing this vision to life is our team of 39,000+ food lovers, creative thinkers, and high performers worldwide. Together, we help provide meals to those in need through our global partnership with Rise Against Hunger. We also stand committed to responsible, sustainable practices that extend to every facet of our business, our consumers, and our communities. Every day, we’re transforming the food industry with bold thinking and unprecedented results. If you share our passion – and are ready to create the future, build a legacy, and lead as a global citizen – there’s only one thing to do: join our table and let’s make life delicious!
Our Culture of Ownership, Meritocracy and Collaboration
We're not afraid to think differently. Embrace new ideas. Dream big. We empower our people at every level – from entry-level intern to senior leader – to own their work. We share a responsibility to think like Owners – to be mindful of the collective and sustained success of Kraft Heinz – which we apply to every situation, every day.
As part of Kraft Heinz, you're supported to grow and achieve. You’re expected to bring your authentic self to work every day, to lead with humility, and drive outstanding performance at every level – and you’ll be rewarded. You’re given opportunities to leave a mark and build a legacy. But you won’t do it alone. You’re supported by passionate teammates along the way, and our collective, collaborative spirit fuels our incredible progress.
Vaccination & Office Collaboration Expectations
Our highest priority is always the health, wellbeing, and safety of our Kraft Heinz family. We require our office-based, home-based, R&D, and sales team members to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19, unless approved for a medical or religious accommodation.
We believe our office environment fuels our collaboration, connection & community as an organization and allows our employees to grow toward greatness. We also believe providing a more flexible and agile model is essential in today’s workplace. A majority of our office-based employees will be able to work remotely for up to two days each week. Additionally, employees who are subject to this hybrid model will be eligible to work from anywhere for up to six weeks in a rolling 12-month period (in maximum two-week increments and according to benefits and tax guidelines). Some jobs may be required to be performed fully in office depending on the role’s responsibilities and requirements.
Kraft Heinz is an Equal Opportunity Employer - Underrepresented Ethnic Minority Groups/Women/Veterans/Individuals with Disabilities/Sexual Orientation/Gender Identity and other protected classes. In order to ensure reasonable accommodation for protected individuals, applicants that require accommodation in the job application process may contact HRCompliance@kraftheinz.com for assistance.

Job Title:
Data Center Systems Analyst (Unix Administrator)

Appointment Type:
Probationary

Time Base:
Full-Time

Date Posted:
February 2, 2023
Closing Date:
Open until filled

Description:
Chancellor's Office Statement
Join our team at the California State University, Office of the Chancellor, and make a difference in providing access to higher education. We are currently seeking experienced candidates for the position of Data Center Systems Analyst. The CSU Chancellor's Office, located on the waterfront adjacent to the Aquarium of the Pacific in downtown Long Beach, is the headquarters for the nation's largest and most diverse system of higher education. The CSU Chancellor's Office offers a premium benefit package that includes outstanding vacation, health, and dental plans; a fee waiver education program; membership in the California Public Employees Retirement System (PERS); and 14 paid holidays a year.
Salary
The salary range for this classification is $4,678 to $11,547 per month. The anticipated salary hiring range is up to $9,895 per month, commensurate with qualifications and experience.
Classification
Operating Systems Analyst
Position Information
The California State University, Office of the Chancellor, is seeking a Data Center Systems Analyst to provide administration, maintenance, and operating systems support in a multi-site 24/7/365 data center and cloud services environment, including installation, setup, monitoring, configuration testing, development, security, and troubleshooting of operating systems, enterprise applications, virtualization technologies, backup, and automation tools.
Responsibilities
The Data Center Systems Analyst is primarily responsible for providing administrative, and operating system support focused on Unix and Linux servers, Cloud services, and cross-platform technologies.
Duties include:
Maintain Unix/Linux server-based applications in a multi-site 24/7/365 environment.
Setup, configure, maintain, troubleshoot, and automate systems deployment within on-premises data centers and cloud-hosted environments such as Microsoft Azure, AWS, and other similar provider environments.
Develop, implement, document, and maintain a standard operating environment (SOE) for all servers, including baseline operating system images, templates, and maintenance of required support tools and applications.
Develop scripts, packages, and other tools to optimize administration, monitoring, and system deployment.
Provide support for Backup Systems, including implementation, maintenance, monitoring, and troubleshooting.
Assist with the administration and support of Windows Servers, Active Directory, Active Directory Integration, and other Windows Enterprise Server-based applications, including Office 365 applications and administrative services.
Gather business requirements, architect, document, and implement IT solutions and meet operational needs.
Plan and execute lifecycle of core services, operating systems, and supporting hardware upgrades.
Perform routine system administration functions such as patch deployment, user account management, and security.
Meet or exceed customer Service Level Agreements (SLAs).
Provide 24x7 operational support, after-hours on-call, and maintenance support for all systems.
Develop and maintain Linux and Windows run books.
Provide advanced-level troubleshooting and interface with customers to resolve problems.
Monitor systems for failure and respond to resolve impacts, and determine the root cause.
Maintain systems security and ensure compliance with system-wide and Chancellor's Office policies.
Maintain the integrity and reliability of systems.
Develop detailed hardware plans, systems operation & technical procedure guidelines.
Adhere to the Chancellor's Office security policies and guidelines in the daily performance of systems administration activities.
Research and provide cost analysis for technology solutions.
Consult with and train technical staff as needed.
Participate in the evaluation of technologies and in developing processes to implement a uniform and consistent methodology of maintaining system and application security.
Implement, maintain, and support datacenter hardware, including servers, blade chassis, and storage systems.
Implement, maintain, and support virtualization platforms.
Gather business requirements, architect, document, and implement IT solutions to meet operational needs.
Recommend and establish policies and procedures to meet operational requirements of key services.
Provide support to desktop and user-support teams to resolve systems and server-related issues.
This position is also responsible for any other duties as assigned. In addition, the incumbent is responsible for keeping current in the industry, including technology changes, trends, and best practices. The incumbent is also responsible for addressing any concerns regarding technical operations with the appropriate supervisor. This position also provides on-site support as operational needs require and coverage for "after-hours" on-call support.
Qualifications
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or related field or equivalent combination of education and work related experience.
Seven to ten years of professional experience supporting a production Unix/Linux environment.
Preferred Qualifications
Communication & People Skills
Solid written communication skills and the ability to provide accurate technical documentation.
Ability to motivate others and build team morale.
Work effectively and cooperatively with other team members to achieve goals, strengthen working relationships, and optimize end-user services.
Ability to effectively communicate with end-users with varying technical expertise.
Effectively communicate and listen and work with others to problem solve.
Ability to gather information, apply solid judgment, and disseminate information.
Analytical Skills
Ability to independently troubleshoot, identify problems, and appropriately respond to situations that impact operations.
Develop practical and thorough solutions.
Identify problems, use appropriate sources to research technical problems, and learn with little to no guidance.
Ability to independently apply technical judgment to decisions that ensure application and system stability, uptime, and security.
Project Management Skills
Ability to track and document information between multiple parties.
Experience in coordinating resource requirements.
Attention to detail and solid organizational skills.
Ability to schedule and prioritize to meet deadlines.
Ability to work independently with little supervision.
Ability to lead a project and implementation teams.
Technical Skills
Extensive experience administering Unix and Linux operating systems.
Knowledge of Windows systems and related hardware.
Experience working in a heterogeneous Windows/Unix/Linux environment is preferred.
Experience installing, configuring, and managing IIS and Apache web servers and web applications preferred.
Concrete understanding of Windows and Unix security, including file system permissions, file sharing, and event logging.
Experience with cloud-hosted environments such as Microsoft Azure, AWS, and other similar provider environments is required.
Experience with VMWare ESXi and vSphere Virtual Infrastructure is required.
Experience with Storage Area Networks (SAN) and Network-attached storage (NAS) technologies and Information Lifecycle Management (ILM) is preferred.
Thorough understanding of enterprise backup technologies implementation is required.
Proficiency with Internet and Windows protocols and standards, including TCP/IP, ICMP, DNS, SMTP, SNMP, SSH, DHCP, IMAP, POP3, MAPI, WINS, CIFS, and any emerging protocols and technologies.
An in-depth understanding of LAN/WAN technologies, including switching, routing, and Internetwork Operating System is required.
Experience with Cisco or Alcatel-Lucent networking equipment is preferred.
Proficiency in Microsoft Office Productivity Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and Outlook), Microsoft Project, and Visio required.
Application Period
Priority consideration will be given to candidates who apply by February 16, 2023. Applications will be accepted until the job posting is removed.
How To Apply

Equal Employment Opportunity
The university is an Equal Opportunity Employer and does not discriminate against persons on the basis of race, religion, color, ancestry, age, disability, genetic information, gender, gender identity, gender expression, marital status, medical condition, National origin, sex, sexual orientation, covered veteran status, or any other protected status. Reasonable accommodations will be provided for qualified applicants with disabilities who self-disclose by contacting the Senior Human Resources Manager at (562) 951-4070.
Title IX
Please view the Notice of Non-Discrimination on the Basis of Gender or Sex and Contact Information for Title IX Coordinator at:
E-Verify
This position requires new hire employment verification to be processed through the E-Verify program administered by the Department of Homeland Security, U.S. Citizenship and Immigration Services (DHSUSCIS)' in partnership with the Social Security Administration (SSA).
If hired, you will be required to furnish proof that you are legally authorized to work in the United States.
COVID19 Vaccination Requirement
The CSU requires faculty, staff, and students who are accessing campus facilities to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 or declare a medical or religious exemption. Any candidates advanced in a currently open search process should be prepared to comply with this requirement as a condition of employment. The systemwide policy can be found at
Background
The Chancellor's Office policy requires that the selected candidate successfully complete a full background check (including a criminal records check) prior to assuming this position.

full_desc:
Every great story has a new beginning, and yours starts here.
Welcome to Warner Bros. Discovery… the stuff dreams are made of.
Who We Are…
When we say, “the stuff dreams are made of,” we’re not just referring to the world of wizards, dragons and superheroes, or even to the wonders of Planet Earth. Behind WBD’s vast portfolio of iconic content and beloved brands, are the storytellers bringing our characters to life, the creators bringing them to your living rooms and the dreamers creating what’s next…
From brilliant creatives, to technology trailblazers, across the globe, WBD offers career defining opportunities, thoughtfully curated benefits, and the tools to explore and grow into your best selves. Here you are supported, here you are celebrated, here you can thrive.
Our studios are considered one of the foremost motion picture and television production and post-production facilities in the world. They inform, engage, and transport audiences to new worlds. The key to that lies with our Studio Operations group, which includes areas like soundstage/backlot set rentals, events, design, culinary, construction, landscaping and much more. Whether it’s hosting an unforgettable studio tour, creating an optimal workspace, or equipping talent to tell the best stories, these teams lay the foundation for the memorable experiences we provide.
Your New Role...
Warner Bros. Discovery seeks Operations Analyst for our Content Data Services who is responsible for managing title and content metadata for Warner Bros. Discovery. The Analyst will be responsible for the creation, collection, and curation of title metadata. This role will focus on the company’s descriptive metadata initiatives, including but not limited to title research, title matching, metadata collection, and metadata quality verifications. The role will work to connect insights from data analyses and research to execute content creation and maintain data quality. The Analyst will need to be hands on to gain a thorough understanding of tools and data, able to work in a fast-paced environment, multitask, and adapt to new technologies and ideas. This role will work closely with other teams within Content Data Services on data curation and special projects for record-matching.
Your Role Accountabilities...
Review, organize, and analyze data sets across Warner Bros. Discovery systems to provide support to system implementations. Research titles from across multiple metadata systems and confirm potential synthetization of records across systems.
Assist with the company's enhanced descriptive metadata initiatives with creation and curation of content data. Analyze content metadata to ensure data accuracy and make corrections as needed. Collect and organize metadata necessary for records to meet minimum standards of quality
Qualifications & Experience...
Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent experience strongly preferred
1+ years of experience preferred in Content Metadata and/or Enhanced Descriptive Metadata disciplines
Proficient in MS Office Suite / Microsoft 365 (Excel, PowerPoint, SharePoint, etc)
Experience with project management, team collaboration and documentation software preferred, e.g. Atlassian Jira, Confluence, Slack, etc.
Experience with master data management software and discipline a plus, e.g. SAP, Informatica, Salesforce, Reltio etc.
Ability to apply technology in solving business technical problems
Strong ability to communicate (written and verbal) with technical and non-technical audiences, as well as be able to facilitate business process discussions with groups of 5-10 people.
Must be an advocate for quality and detail-oriented.
Must be comfortable working with a reasonable level of autonomy after instruction.
Must be able to organize and schedule work effectively and work well under time constraints, project management skills a plus.
Must be able to handle multiple tasks with changing priorities, communicating changes in scope and schedule to all parties concerned.
Must be able to maintain confidentiality.
How We Get Things Done…
This last bit is probably the most important! Here at WBD, our guiding principles are the core values by which we operate and are central to how we get things done. You can find them at www.wbd.com/guiding-principles/ along with some insights from the team on what they mean and how they show up in their day to day. We hope they resonate with you and look forward to discussing them during your interview.
The Legal Bits…
Warner Bros. Discovery embraces the opportunity to build a workforce that reflects the diversity of our society and the world around us. Being an equal opportunity employer means that we take seriously our responsibility to consider qualified candidates on the basis of merit, without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, mental or physical disability, and genetic information, marital status, citizenship status, military status, protected veteran status or any other category protected by law.
If you’re a qualified candidate with a disability and you need a reasonable accommodation in order to apply for this position, please contact us at recruitadmin@wbd.com.

With a critical focus on building Data Management Capability across all data assets, the Enterprise Data Governance team has the mission to establish data as a strategic asset with the right standards of care applied through the enablement of foundational capabilities achieving higher data maturity and delivering business value. Key focus areas for the data governance function are:
As the Product Data Analyst, you will be instrumental in nurturing a customer and data-centric approach in our Product, Design, and Engineering organization by building data products in our One Data Catalog platform.
Product Data Analysts responsible for:
Managing, configuring, and monitoring the internal instances of the One Data Catalog platform directly.

Mandatory: Establish data standards and build foundational components such as Data policy, Enterprise glossary, and data ownership.

Provide Enterprise data governance platform and tools to operationalize data governance
Leverage Collibra API to meet the integration needs with the Collibra DGC platform
Validation support of Metadata import and export jobs and creation of Data Governance reporting/KPIs
Responsible for adherence to SDLC policies and standards for technical management of the Collibra DGC platform
Maintain a solid understanding of Collibra DGC capabilities and the product's roadmap to ensure the adequate technical design of solutions in the platform
Supporting ad-hoc questions from the Product, Design, and Engineering leadership team for data requests and visualization
Promoting a data-driven culture in Product, Design, and Engineering (Enable your stakeholders to leverage your work and build their own insights
Being the critical stakeholder for Product, Design, and Engineering to the Data Office team to build and maintain an entirely self-service model where every team can add queries to get insights into product usage or content from our cloud customer base
Validate completeness of data lineage between the point of data element creation (system of record) and the point where it is consumed by business users (trusted data sources) and design processes for implementation to certify Tier 1 KDEs and Reports
Demonstrated ability to understand business processes and pain points to lead the definition of data requirements to meet complex business needs and drive data quality

full_desc:
Overview:
The Business Analyst provides process documentation and analytical support for discrete projects. The Business Analyst will develop and manage project-based deliverables that include: process mapping, gathering business requirements, gathering and reporting operational metrics, project financial and operational analysis/reporting. This individual will also support peers and management to interpret performance data and develop recommendations for business solutions. The individual will work as part of a team supporting enterprise business software applications and infrastructure projects.
Responsibilities:
Conduct analysis of business processes: current state analysis, gap analysis, benchmarking, best practices identification
Facilitate business unit understanding of technical capabilities of enterprise applications through discussions and by conducting or coordinating demonstrations
Interface with internal customers to formulate and define scope and objectives based on both user needs and a thorough understanding of business systems and industry requirements; consider business application of technology to both current and future business environment
Conduct research and synthesize information to substantiate recommendations
Communicate with management, personnel and vendors to coordinate activities and programs; resolve issues and conflicts and exchange information; respond to various requests for information from internal/external sources
Develop detailed application, product, and/or tool selection evaluation criteria based on identified product requirements
Engage vendor partners to assist in complex solutions where appropriate
Examine best practices and monitor industry trends in various fields to accomplish business objectives
Perform other duties as assigned.
Qualifications:
1. Bachelor’s degree in public health, computer science, math, statistics or related field with appropriate professional and technical experience required with 3+ years in data management, reporting and analytics required OR Master’s degree in public health, computer science, math, biostatistics, epidemiology, information management or related field with 1-2 years in data management, reporting and analytics required.
2. 1 to 3 years of experience in business analysis, project coordination activities and designing end-to-end business processes in an outpatient clinic setting and/or enterprise support department strongly preferred
3. Understanding of process improvement methodology (e.g. Lean, Six Sigma, or TQM) preferred
4. Prior experience gathering and documenting business and technical requirements within healthcare highly preferred
5. Knowledge and demonstrated experience with SQL, Tableau, and/or R required

Prior experience within healthcare preferred
Our client seeking an experienced Technical Business Analyst to join their team. This individual will serve as the customer-facing side of the technical IT organization, working with our internal customers, vendors, and partners, to optimize services within the client Service Catalog with an eye for consolidation, standardization, and streamlining of those services.
This individual will help design, document, and facilitate the creation, modification, termination, consolidation, and optimization of enterprise workflows, playing a key role in facilitating the organization’s rapid growth. This position entails documenting the current state and analyzing for improvements, ensuring that workflows are designed and implemented in an optimal manner, and documenting existing workflows in high detail. The successful candidate will have expertise in a variety of tools, especially Confluence and standard workflow diagramming software. This individual will be expected to possess the ability to add value across multiple areas of the business through effective process analysis, requirements development, and documentation - in addition to being comfortable in both an enterprise business environment and a highly technical environment.
Job Responsibilities:
· Actively promote, analyze, and evaluate services with an eye for standardization, optimization, and consolidation.
· Manage partners and vendors including but not limited to contracts and renewals, procurement and provisioning, relationship management, and overseeing the health of the services within our portfolio.
· Track adoption rate and usage of services, general health of the service and the relationships with key stakeholders.
· Create workflow diagrams to document current and future business environments. Validates documentation with the customer and shares with project stakeholders. Applies a thorough understanding of business processes and user needs to formulate and define system scope and objectives.
· Facilitate requirements gathering sessions to understand and document complex business needs, often eliciting hidden requirements and/or clarifying vague or unclear requirements.
· Participate in requirements-gathering sessions with end users.
· Analyze business operations and processes to understand strengths and weaknesses.
· Preemptively troubleshoot workflow challenges and recommend improvements.
· Create requirements definition documentation and functional specifications to capture business needs using advanced business processes.
· Conceive, and support, the design of projects that may require integration across multiple technical platforms. Analyzes information requirements that may cross multiple systems.
· Track the progress of projects to ensure alignment with requirements; manage any deviations from requirements to ensure resolution.
· Support the definition of requirements, and how to best address them, considering the goals of the whole organization.
· Identify potential opportunities to automate and/or improve existing processes.
· Implement workflow automation using a variety of tools and resources.
· Analyze data to identify improvement opportunities and key breakdowns of workflows.
· Perform first-level user acceptance testing to ensure that solutions meet business goals.
· Respond to staff questions regarding the effective use of our systems for daily tasks.
· Work with key stakeholders to develop an ongoing roadmap of system improvements.
· Work with department stakeholders to capture and maintain a prioritized list of projects and technology opportunities.
· Communicate with key department stakeholders regarding project status.
Basic Qualifications:
· 5+ years of professional experience in large-scale enterprise environments.
· An understanding of ITIL practices.
· Maintains current knowledge of industry and business process trends and is able to apply that knowledge to existing business processes with a focus on process improvement.
· Possesses familiarity with multiple technologies, business analysis tools, development methods, systems, and relevant programming languages, specifically visual workflow diagramming tools such as Mindmanager and/or MS Visio.
· Understanding complex business processes and is capable of documenting them in a logical and comprehensible manner.
· Good understanding of the general competitive landscape from a business and technology perspective.
· Experience working with an ITSM ticketing system.
· Excellent written and oral communication skills, along with collaborative team skills.
· Ability to think critically and solve complex issues.
· Ability to prioritize across multiple projects and meet deadlines.
· Experience working with classified information such as HIPPA, SOX, and financial data.

full_desc:
About TREND Community
Founded in 2017 by parents with a child born with a rare disease, TREND Community’s vision is to revolutionize the world’s understanding of diseases. Leveraging AI techniques, such as Natural Language Processing (NLP) and Machine Learning (ML), our technology analyzes real-world conversations to uncover insights that are used by our communities and our clients to help establish natural history, identify unmet needs, understand quality of life issues, catalyze research, and spread awareness. As a result, our community-centric approach is accelerating the discovery and delivery of new treatments.
Position Summary
As a Data Analyst, you will work alongside the NLP/ML engineers and data scientists to enhance and improve our analytics engine, Krystie. You will provide insight into new analytical approaches and degradation of existing NLP models and enhance the company’s current methods and internal lexical knowledge base.
What You’ll Do
Work within our internal data analytics platform, which handles all our analytics and AI workloads
Produce tables and figures in a publication-quality form summarizing the results of statistical analyses and present these results
Maintain accountability of documentation, standardization of processes used, and the ability to reproduce your findings
As a small, agile company with multiple concurrent projects, you will need to think fast on your feet and switch context at a moment’s notice
Always consider our community’s best interests while performing your duties
What You Have
Advanced degree (Masters or Doctorate) in Statistics, Social Science, Public Health, or a related field
Background in linguistics, particularly with an emphasis on corpus analysis
Clinical research, medical anthropology, or epidemiology backgrounds
Graduated from an accredited college or an equivalent combination of education and experience
Experience conducting end-to-end research projects on unstructured datasets (e.g., social media conversations)
Comfortable working in a notebook environment and have experience with at least one programming language (R, SQL, or Python)
Experience with cloud computing environment (e.g., Databricks)
Good communication and storytelling skills to present your findings to both our industry and community partners
Should possess critical thinking skills, along with a curious nature to find novel concepts buried within the data
The ability to work within a team and collaborate effectively with your other team members
U.S. citizen, legal U.S. resident, or legally allowed to work in the U.S. (we are currently not sponsoring applicant work visas)
What We Offer
Medical benefits
Retirement plan
15 PTO days and pre-approved PTO
Innovative environment
Mac equipment
An opportunity to truly impact people’s lives through your work
How We Communicate
Below are the standard tools you will have exposure to and be comfortable working with at TREND Community:
Productivity software such as Microsoft Office, Google Workspace, and Slack
Video conferencing software such as Zoom, Teams, and Google Meet
CRM software such as Monday.com
Special Requirements
Successful candidates must pass a criminal background check
This is a hybrid role—candidates interested in a remote-only position should not apply
Candidates who submit a cover letter along with their resume and display a strong interest in the company’s mission will be given preference

When you join James Moore and Co., P.L. you are joining a firm that sees you as MOORE. We believe in a firm that values who you are and the unique ideas you bring to the table. We know you have goals, both personal and professional, and we want to work together to make those goals a reality. Together we are MOORE.
Why you'll love it at James Moore:
More Valued: Open door policies allow you to have a voice to Suggest new and better ways of doing what we do and actively participate in the innovation to evolve the Firm overtime.
More Flexible: We value our vacation time just as much as our work! Here at JMCO, you'll be met with flexible PTO and work from home options in an environment where we hold ourselves accountable to get the work done on our own time.
More Impactful: Here at James Moore, we provide solutions to the small businesses that impact our local economies and to non-profits that make a difference where we work and play.
More Secure: Saving for your future? James Moore offers a 4-5% annual contribution to ALL employees through our 401K program, regardless of what they can contribute to their own savings.
More Balanced: Prioritizing your physical and mental health? Good. We know the best contributors are healthy contributors. That's why JMCO pays for 100% of their employees' basic healthcare, dental, and vision coverage.
Our firm is seeking a Data Analyst to develop, deploy, and maintain BI interfaces on behalf of both the firm and the various clients and industries that we serve. These include query tools, data visualization, interactive dashboards, ad hoc reporting, and data modeling tools.
Who you are:
You will enjoy creating your own path, a path to success not predetermined for you but made with you.
You'll be flexible, adaptable, and empowered to add your own spin to our uncommon culture inspired by our diverse team members.
You'll relish the challenge of dynamic work on multiple projects with different deadlines.
You'll have a strong sense of ownership and a willingness to work collaboratively to create and implement successful solutions.
You will strive to be an expert in your area of practice and diligently pursue relevant credentials and certifications.
What you will do in this role:
Collect, clean and analyze large and complex data sets using tools such as SQL, Python, R, and Excel
Identify patterns, trends, and insights in data and use this information to provide recommendations to stakeholders
Develop and maintain dashboards and reports to visualize and communicate key metrics and insights
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand business needs and translate them into data requirements
Communicate insights and recommendations to stakeholders in a clear and actionable manner
Continuously monitor and evaluate model performance and update models as necessary
Stay up-to-date with the latest trends and developments in data analysis, machine learning, and data science and share best practices with the team
What you'll bring to the table:
Steadfast in the pursuit of knowledge and regarding new tools and techniques
Bachelor's degree in a quantitative field such as Mathematics, Statistics, Economics, or Computer Science
2-5 years of experience in data analysis, data science, or a related field
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Proficiency in SQL, Python, R, and Excel
Experience with data visualization tools such as Tableau or Power BI
Experience with machine learning frameworks such as TensorFlow, PyTorch, or scikit-learn
Excellent communication and collaboration skills
Ability to work independently and manage multiple priorities in a fast-paced environment
James Moore & Co., P.L. is a Top 200 public accounting and business consulting firm located in Florida with offices in Daytona Beach, DeLand, Gainesville, Ocala, and Tallahassee. Our practice includes tax, assurance, accounting & controllership, wealth management, HR solutions, technology solutions, data analytics and business intelligence, and business advisory services. Our diverse industry specializations include start-up technology, healthcare, government, nonprofit, manufacturing, higher education, construction and real estate. For more information about our firm, please visit us at www.jmco.com

The Senior Analyst - FP&A is responsible for tracking financial performance of Maintenance Capital expense, forecasting, and variance analysis. Assists and supports short and long-term Maintenance Capital and O&M expense planning activities.
Essential Duties and Responsibilities:
Perform detailed variance analysis of actual financial results versus plan, forecast, and key performance metrics
Identify trends in variances and make recommendations for financial improvement and optimization to management
Work closely with accounting to ensure accurate financial reporting
Coordinate with field analysts, operations management, and project managers to accurately budget and forecast projects
